MESSAGE.Translation: I decided to finish reading it that night.

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「なー、理樹ってばよー」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝Heeey, Rikiiii.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝Heeey, Rikiiii.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 隣で真人が喋りかけてくるのにも慣れてきた。
MESSAGE.EN: I was used to Masato trying to cut me off.
MESSAGE.Translation: I was used to Masato trying to cut me off.

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「あれ？　おまえの顔ってさ…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝Wait. If your face were to get turned upside-down...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝Wait. If your face were to get turned upside-down...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「さかさまにすると、怒った人の顔に見えるんじゃね？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝Wouldn't it look like the face of an angry guy?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝Wouldn't it look like the face of an angry guy?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「くそぅ…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝Damn it...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝Damn it...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「いでっ！　いででで！」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝It hurts! Hurrrrts!❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝It hurts! Hurrrrts!❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「ケツが割れた！　１ダースに！」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝My ass got torn apart into one dozen pieces!❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝My ass got torn apart into one dozen pieces!❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「理樹、助けてくれ…ケツが１２分割に…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝Riki, help me... My ass got split into twelve...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝Riki, help me... My ass got split into twelve...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「本物がどれだかわからない…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝I can't tell which one is real...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝I can't tell which one is real...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「理樹、理樹よぅ…ケツがよぅ…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝Riki, Rikiii... My ass...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝Riki, Rikiii... My ass...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「なにぃ…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝...Whaaat...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝...Whaaat...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「参ったぜ…今日は諦めて筋トレしとくか…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝Well I'll be... I'll give up and do some training...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝Well I'll be... I'll give up and do some training...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「ふっ！　ほっ！　ふっ！」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝Hoo! Hoh! Hoo!❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝Hoo! Hoh! Hoo!❞

MESSAGE.JP: 真人のかけ声混じる部屋で、僕は読書を続ける。
MESSAGE.EN: Listening to his ragged breathing, I kept reading.
MESSAGE.Translation: Listening to his ragged breathing, I kept reading.

MESSAGE.JP: それは不思議な話だった。
MESSAGE.EN: The story was a strange one.
MESSAGE.Translation: The story was a strange one.

MESSAGE.JP: ただ事件が起きて、その真相を推理するというミステリとは少し違っていた。
MESSAGE.EN: It was a bit different from conventional mysteries where a crime was committed, and a detective tried to piece it together.
MESSAGE.Translation: It was a bit different from conventional mysteries where a crime was committed, and a detective tried to piece it together.

MESSAGE.JP: 登場人物の中の一人が、自分の周りの人たちを題材にして小説を書いている。
MESSAGE.EN: One of the characters in the story wrote a novel based on people around him.
MESSAGE.Translation: One of the characters in the story wrote a novel based on people around him.

MESSAGE.JP: 実際の周りの出来事と、彼の書いている小説が奇数章と偶数章で交互に続いていく。
MESSAGE.EN: The odd number chapters consisted of actual events, and the even number ones, on the other hand, consisted of fiction he created.
MESSAGE.Translation: The odd number chapters consisted of actual events, and the even number ones, on the other hand, consisted of fiction he created.

MESSAGE.JP: 現実と小説、そのどちらでも起こる殺人事件。
MESSAGE.EN: Murders took place in both parts.
MESSAGE.Translation: Murders took place in both parts.

MESSAGE.JP: 前の章で殺された人物が、次の章では生きている。
MESSAGE.EN: Somebody who was killed in one chapter was alive in the next.
MESSAGE.Translation: Somebody who was killed in one chapter was alive in the next.

MESSAGE.JP: でも話が進むにつれて、その垣根は曖昧なものになる。
MESSAGE.EN: However, the more the story moved on, the more the line between the two blurred.
MESSAGE.Translation: However, the more the story moved on, the more the line between the two blurred.

MESSAGE.JP: 次第に現実と虚構はリンクしていく…。
MESSAGE.EN: Reality blended with fiction, little by little...
MESSAGE.Translation: Reality blended with fiction, little by little...

MESSAGE.JP: 読んでいるうちに、僕は…つまり読者は混乱してくる。
MESSAGE.EN: The further you read, the more perplexed you got.
MESSAGE.Translation: The further you read, the more perplexed you got.

MESSAGE.JP: 一体、どっちが現実の話なんだろう。一体、どっちが小説の話なんだろう。
MESSAGE.EN: Which story was real? Which one was imaginary?
MESSAGE.Translation: Which story was real? Which one was imaginary?

MESSAGE.JP: この人は生きているんだろうか、死んでいるんだろうか。
MESSAGE.EN: Was he alive? Was she dead?
MESSAGE.Translation: Was he alive? Was she dead?

MESSAGE.JP: 冷静に考えると、そう思うこと自体おかしい。
MESSAGE.EN: Thinking rationally, there was nothing to be confused about, though.
MESSAGE.Translation: Thinking rationally, there was nothing to be confused about, though.

MESSAGE.JP: だって、どっちも小説なんだから。僕、直枝理樹が読んでいる本の中の話だ。
MESSAGE.EN: ALL the stuff written in the book was fiction.
MESSAGE.Translation: ALL the stuff written in the book was fiction.

MESSAGE.JP: 本を読んでいる僕が現実。本の中はすべて虚構。
MESSAGE.EN: I, the reader of the book, was real, and everything written in it was unreal.
MESSAGE.Translation: I, the reader of the book, was real, and everything written in it was unreal.

MESSAGE.JP: それが真実のはずだ。
MESSAGE.EN: That should be the truth.
MESSAGE.Translation: That should be the truth.

MESSAGE.JP: それなのに。
MESSAGE.EN: Nevertheless.
MESSAGE.Translation: Nevertheless.

MESSAGE.JP: なんだろう、この不安な気持ちは。
MESSAGE.EN: It gave me an uneasy feeling I couldn't put into words.
MESSAGE.Translation: It gave me an uneasy feeling I couldn't put into words.

MESSAGE.JP: ようやく読み終えた後も、僕は本を片手にぼんやりしていた。
MESSAGE.EN: I was spacing out with the book in my hand even after having finished it.
MESSAGE.Translation: I was spacing out with the book in my hand even after having finished it.

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「なに、難しい顔してんだよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝What's going on? Such a serious look.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝What's going on? Such a serious look.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 気づけば、真人のかけ声は止んでいた。覗き込むように僕の隣りに立っていた。
MESSAGE.EN: Masato, done with his training, was standing beside me and peering into my face.
MESSAGE.Translation: Masato, done with his training, was standing beside me and peering into my face.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「ううん、別に…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝No, nothing...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝No, nothing...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「そうか、面白くなかったか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝Aha, it was a boring piece, right?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝Aha, it was a boring piece, right?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「あーあ、もったいねぇ、これなら真人が背筋の時に足を押さえる役をやってたほうが有意義だった…と後悔してるんだろ？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝And you started regretting that you didn't help me with a back-muscle workout instead... right?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝And you started regretting that you didn't help me with a back-muscle workout instead... right?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「いや、それは決してないけど」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Never...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Never...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「ねえ、真人」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Say, Masato.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Say, Masato.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「現実って何だと思う？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝What do you think reality is?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝What do you think reality is?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「はっ？　なんだそりゃ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝Huh? What the hell's that question?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝Huh? What the hell's that question?❞

MESSAGE.JP: その質問に、真人は呆れた様子だ。
MESSAGE.EN: He asked me back in surprise.
MESSAGE.Translation: He asked me back in surprise.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「うん、ちょっとね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Well, it's no big deal.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Well, it's no big deal.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「ふんっ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝Hoon!❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝Hoon!❞

MESSAGE.JP: 真人がいきなり気合いを入れる。
MESSAGE.EN: He pumped himself up.
MESSAGE.Translation: He pumped himself up.

MESSAGE.JP: 鍛えた筋肉が盛り上がりを見せて、二の腕が膨らむ。
MESSAGE.EN: And then he flexed his well-developed bicep.
MESSAGE.Translation: And then he flexed his well-developed bicep.

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「見ろ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝Look at it.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝Look at it.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「…いや、ごめんだけど」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝...I'd rather not.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝...I'd rather not.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「現実ってのは、…この筋肉みたいなもんだ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝Reality is just like... this muscle.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝Reality is just like... this muscle.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「…何だよ、それ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝...What do you mean?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝...What do you mean?❞

MESSAGE.JP: 今度は僕が呆れる番だった。
MESSAGE.EN: This time, I was the one surprised.
MESSAGE.Translation: This time, I was the one surprised.

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「こうやってオレが力を入れることで、普段は隠されている筋肉がよく見えるようになるだろ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝The hidden muscles can only be seen when strained.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝The hidden muscles can only be seen when strained.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「どうだ、このはち切れんばかりの力こぶ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝Look at these massive muscles of mine.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝Look at these massive muscles of mine.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「また少し太くなった気がするぜ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝I think they grew a little stronger than before.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝I think they grew a little stronger than before.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「いや、それをオレは美しく…と言い換えよう」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝No, strong isn't the right word... I should describe it as beautiful.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝No, strong isn't the right word... I should describe it as beautiful.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「で、何が言いたいのさ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝So, what you are trying to say is...?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝So, what you are trying to say is...?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「つまりだな…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝The point is...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝The point is...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「そうやって意識しない限り、普段は気にしないってことだよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝Anything is ignored unless people pay attention to it.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝Anything is ignored unless people pay attention to it.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「これでわかんねえなら、理樹には伝えようがねぇよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝If you don't understand me with this, there's no other way to convey it.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝If you don't understand me with this, there's no other way to convey it.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「答えてやったんだから、背筋手伝ってくれよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝Help me with another workout in return for my answer.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝Help me with another workout in return for my answer.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 結局、夜中まで付き合わされる羽目になった。
MESSAGE.EN: I ended up spending the rest of the evening assisting him in his training.
MESSAGE.Translation: I ended up spending the rest of the evening assisting him in his training.

MESSAGE.JP: 多分、真人なりの気の使い方だったんだろう。
MESSAGE.EN: That was his way of showing his concern for me, I suppose.
MESSAGE.Translation: That was his way of showing his concern for me, I suppose.

MESSAGE.JP: それに、真人の言うことはわからないでもない。
MESSAGE.EN: And it wasn't like I didn't understand his explanation at all.
MESSAGE.Translation: And it wasn't like I didn't understand his explanation at all.

MESSAGE.JP: 本という『虚構』に触れることで、僕は『現実』を思う。
MESSAGE.EN: Experiencing ❛unreality❜ materialized as books made me wonder about ❛reality.❜
MESSAGE.Translation: Experiencing ❛unreality❜ materialized as books made me wonder about ❛reality.❜

MESSAGE.JP: そうでなければ、普段は気にもしないことだ。
MESSAGE.EN: I wouldn't have even thought about it if I hadn't read the book.
MESSAGE.Translation: I wouldn't have even thought about it if I hadn't read the book.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「この本、ありがとう」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Thanks for lending me the book.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Thanks for lending me the book.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「なんか変わった話だったね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝The story was somewhat unusual.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝The story was somewhat unusual.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「そうですね…。双子がお薦めですよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝That's true... I recommend the twins.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝That's true... I recommend the twins.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 双子？　確かに出てきたけど。
MESSAGE.EN: A pair of twins did appear in the story.
MESSAGE.Translation: A pair of twins did appear in the story.

MESSAGE.JP: 何がお薦めなんだろう？
MESSAGE.EN: But what did she mean by recommend?
MESSAGE.Translation: But what did she mean by recommend?

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「美少年ですから」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Because they are both pretty boys.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Because they are both pretty boys.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「は、はあ…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Eh, right...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Eh, right...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「…それにしても、不思議な読後感だったね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝...I got a strange feeling after I finished the book, by the way.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝...I got a strange feeling after I finished the book, by the way.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「これは『奇書』と呼ばれる類の小説です。読んだ人の精神に影響を与えるかも知れません」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝The genre of the novel is called curiosa; it can greatly affect the reader inwardly.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝The genre of the novel is called curiosa; it can greatly affect the reader inwardly.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「…直枝さんも、何か感じ取ったものがあるのですか？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝...Did you get some particular feelings from the book, too?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝...Did you get some particular feelings from the book, too?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「うん、上手く言えないけど…なんか、頭がごっちゃになるみたいな変な感じが」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Yes. How should I say... Well, it confused me quite a bit.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Yes. How should I say... Well, it confused me quite a bit.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「今自分がいる、この世界がとても不確かなものに思えてくるんだ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝It made me feel uncertain even about this world.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝It made me feel uncertain even about this world.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「………真人が言ったんだけど」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝.........Here's what Masato said.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝.........Here's what Masato said.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 僕は昨日の真人の台詞を口にする。
MESSAGE.EN: I gave her an account of what he had said the previous evening.
MESSAGE.Translation: I gave her an account of what he had said the previous evening.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「そうですか…。井ノ原さんはなかなか面白いことを言いますね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝I see... Inohara-san can be quite interesting.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝I see... Inohara-san can be quite interesting.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「知的な井ノ原さん×無知な直枝さん…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Intelligent Inohara-san X ignorant Naoe-san...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Intelligent Inohara-san X ignorant Naoe-san...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「このギャップはなかなか…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝That gap is not bad...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝That gap is not bad...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「あの、西園さん？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Hello?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Hello?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「…失礼」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝...Excuse me.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝...Excuse me.❞

MESSAGE.JP: そして、咳払いをひとつ。
MESSAGE.EN: She cleared her throat.
MESSAGE.Translation: She cleared her throat.

MESSAGE.JP: よかった。
MESSAGE.EN: Good.
MESSAGE.Translation: Good.

MESSAGE.JP: 今日はいつもの西園さんだ。
MESSAGE.EN: She was her usual self today.
MESSAGE.Translation: She was her usual self today.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「西園さんはどう思う？　現実って何だろう？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝What about you? What do you think reality is?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝What about you? What do you think reality is?❞

MESSAGE.JP: 少し考える間があった後、西園さんはゆっくりと口を開いた。
MESSAGE.EN: After a short consideration, she slowly opened her mouth.
MESSAGE.Translation: After a short consideration, she slowly opened her mouth.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「現実とは…記憶です」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Reality is... what we remember.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Reality is... what we remember.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「記憶？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝What we remember?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝What we remember?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「直枝さん、わたし達はどうやって『現実』を認識すると思いますか？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Naoe-san, how do you think you recognize reality?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Naoe-san, how do you think you recognize reality?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「それは…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝I think...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝I think...❞

MESSAGE.JP: 目で見て、耳で聞いて、手で触れる。
MESSAGE.EN: By seeing, hearing, or touching.
MESSAGE.Translation: By seeing, hearing, or touching.

MESSAGE.JP: いわゆる五感からの情報で、僕たちは現実を知る。
MESSAGE.EN: We recognize reality by obtaining information through what's collectively called the five senses.
MESSAGE.Translation: We recognize reality by obtaining information through what's collectively called the five senses.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「はい…。そして、その情報が蓄積されるのは脳です」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Yes... And you accumulate all the information in your brain.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Yes... And you accumulate all the information in your brain.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「たった今、こうして口にしたわたしの言葉は直枝さんの耳を通じて、直枝さんの脳に届きます」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝For example, what I just said goes into your brain through your ears.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝For example, what I just said goes into your brain through your ears.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「直枝さんの脳は、その情報を『記憶』として留め置きます」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝And your brain stocks it as a memory within itself.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝And your brain stocks it as a memory within itself.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「それは瞬きするよりも短い間の出来事です」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝The whole process takes place in the blink of an eye.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝The whole process takes place in the blink of an eye.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「生まれてからこの方、数百分の一秒という瞬間をわたし達は何億回も繰り返して脳に刻んでいます」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Ever since you were born, you've been repeating the same process countless billions of times.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Ever since you were born, you've been repeating the same process countless billions of times.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「その繰り返しで、わたし達は現実を記憶という形で認識し続けているんです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝And those memories come together to form what you recognize as reality.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝And those memories come together to form what you recognize as reality.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 今、その西園さんが口にした言葉も。
MESSAGE.EN: What she had just said...
MESSAGE.Translation: What she had just said...

MESSAGE.JP: こうして、すでに僕の中では記憶になっている。
MESSAGE.EN: ...also turned into a memory in my brain.
MESSAGE.Translation: ...also turned into a memory in my brain.

MESSAGE.JP: 常に瞬きするよりも寸前の過去としてしか、僕らは『現実』を知ることはない。
MESSAGE.EN: People can only acknowledge reality as a past event that they experienced just a second ago.
MESSAGE.Translation: People can only acknowledge reality as a past event that they experienced just a second ago.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「そういえば…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Speaking of which...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Speaking of which...❞

MESSAGE.JP: 『過去』という言葉から、僕はデジャ・ヴュの話を思い出す。
MESSAGE.EN: The word ❛past❜ reminded me of our conversation on deja vu.
MESSAGE.Translation: The word ❛past❜ reminded me of our conversation on deja vu.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「『言われてみればそうだったかも知れない』は、すぐに『そうだったに違いない』と頭の中で置き換わってしまう…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝❛Now that I think about it, that might be true❜ can immediately turn into ❛It's true, there's no mistake❜ in your head.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝❛Now that I think about it, that might be true❜ can immediately turn into ❛It's true, there's no mistake❜ in your head.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 西園さんが口にした言葉を、呟く。
MESSAGE.EN: I whispered the words she had said earlier.
MESSAGE.Translation: I whispered the words she had said earlier.

MESSAGE.JP: 現実が短い過去の再生の繰り返しでしかないのだとしたら。
MESSAGE.EN: If reality is but a series of short, past moments played over and over in one's brain...
MESSAGE.Translation: If reality is but a series of short, past moments played over and over in one's brain...

MESSAGE.JP: そこに『置き換え』が生じるのは…必然なのか。
MESSAGE.EN: ...is it necessary that the conversion be done at all...?
MESSAGE.Translation: ...is it necessary that the conversion be done at all...?

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「現実と虚構を区別することはできません」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Reality and unreality can't be distinguished.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Reality and unreality can't be distinguished.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「その境界は極めて、曖昧です」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝The border between them is extremely ambiguous.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝The border between them is extremely ambiguous.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「ちょうど…空と海が混じり合う水平線のように、です」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Just like... the horizon which appears between the sky and the sea.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Just like... the horizon which appears between the sky and the sea.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「だから…そんなことを考えるのは無駄なんです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Hence... there's no point in trying to find it.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Hence... there's no point in trying to find it.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「誰にも、分からないのですから」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝No one knows where one ends and the other begins.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝No one knows where one ends and the other begins.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「記憶と過去、そして現実と虚構は容易に入れ替わる不安定な存在です」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Memory and past, fact and fiction. They are all shrouded in uncertainty and can easily be exchanged.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Memory and past, fact and fiction. They are all shrouded in uncertainty and can easily be exchanged.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「それはまるで、昼の現世（うつしよ）と夜の夢のように、です」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝The relationship between them is the same as the one between the daytime's transience and the night's dreams.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝The relationship between them is the same as the one between the daytime's transience and the night's dreams.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「でも…もしも、その『境界線』に立つことができれば…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝But... if you could stand right on the border...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝But... if you could stand right on the border...❞

MESSAGE.JP: それはもはや独り言だった。
MESSAGE.EN: She was talking to herself, not to me anymore.
MESSAGE.Translation: She was talking to herself, not to me anymore.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「西園さん、そろそろ予鈴が鳴るよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Nishizono-san, next class will start shortly. We should go.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Nishizono-san, next class will start shortly. We should go.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 僕が呼びかけると、西園さんがゆっくりと視線を向けた。
MESSAGE.EN: She slowly opened her eyes to look at me.
MESSAGE.Translation: She slowly opened her eyes to look at me.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「はい」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Sure.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Sure.❞

MESSAGE.JP: そして柔らかな笑顔で頷いてくれた。
MESSAGE.EN: And then she nodded with a soft smile.
MESSAGE.Translation: And then she nodded with a soft smile.

MESSAGE.JP: 西園さんが揺れている。
MESSAGE.EN: Somehow, I got the impression...
MESSAGE.Translation: Somehow, I got the impression...

MESSAGE.JP: なぜか、そんな気がした。
MESSAGE.EN: ...that she was swaying.
MESSAGE.Translation: ...that she was swaying.

MESSAGE.JP: `教師@「じゃあ、次の文章を…２３番訳して」
MESSAGE.EN: `Teacher@❝All right, translate the next sentence... Number 23.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Teacher@❝All right, translate the next sentence... Number 23.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 英語の先生は当てる順番に法則があるから、分かりやすい。
MESSAGE.EN: Our English teacher applied several simple rules to call on his students.
MESSAGE.Translation: Our English teacher applied several simple rules to call on his students.

MESSAGE.JP: さっきから出席番号が１１、１３、１７、１９と当てられている。
MESSAGE.EN: He had called upon attendance numbers 11, 13, 17 and 19 so far.
MESSAGE.Translation: He had called upon attendance numbers 11, 13, 17 and 19 so far.

MESSAGE.JP: …どうやら今日のルールは素数みたいだ。
MESSAGE.EN: ...He was seemingly using prime numbers today.
MESSAGE.Translation: ...He was seemingly using prime numbers today.

MESSAGE.JP: `生徒@「…$K109万歳三唱$K0で、そのパーティは終わった」
MESSAGE.EN: `Student@❝...The party was drawn to a close by $K109three rousing cheers$K0.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Student@❝...The party was drawn to a close by $K109three rousing cheers$K0.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `教師@「はい、そこまで」
MESSAGE.EN: `Teacher@❝Good, that's it.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Teacher@❝Good, that's it.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 読み終えた２３番の生徒が着席する。
MESSAGE.EN: Student number 23 sat back down.
MESSAGE.Translation: Student number 23 sat back down.

MESSAGE.JP: 今日は僕が当たることはなさそうだ。ほっとする。
MESSAGE.EN: Thank goodness I'm not gonna be called in this class.
MESSAGE.Translation: Thank goodness I'm not gonna be called in this class.

MESSAGE.JP: 次は２９番か…確か、西園さんじゃないかな。
MESSAGE.EN: Next up would be number 29... which was Nishizono-san.
MESSAGE.Translation: Next up would be number 29... which was Nishizono-san.

MESSAGE.JP: 西園さんの方を見ると、やはり分かっているみたいで教科書を手に身構えていた。
MESSAGE.EN: I took a look at her and found her already ready for her turn.
MESSAGE.Translation: I took a look at her and found her already ready for her turn.

MESSAGE.JP: `教師@「えー、じゃあ次は…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Teacher@❝Well, next is...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Teacher@❝Well, next is...❞

MESSAGE.JP: でも、指名されたのは３１番だった。
MESSAGE.EN: However, the number he called was 31.
MESSAGE.Translation: However, the number he called was 31.

MESSAGE.JP: 西園さんは忘れられたみたいに、順番を飛ばされる。
MESSAGE.EN: Nishizono-san was skipped as though she were forgotten.
MESSAGE.Translation: Nishizono-san was skipped as though she were forgotten.

MESSAGE.JP: 意表をつかれたのは、クドだ。
MESSAGE.EN: But the one who was the most surprised was Kud.
MESSAGE.Translation: But the one who was the most surprised was Kud.

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「わ、わふー」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝Wa-wafuu.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝Wa-wafuu.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `教師@「どうした、能美。早く立って」
MESSAGE.EN: `Teacher@❝What's wrong, Noumi? Stand up and translate.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Teacher@❝What's wrong, Noumi? Stand up and translate.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「は、はい」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝Y-yes.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝Y-yes.❞

MESSAGE.JP: ガタガタっと立った拍子に椅子を倒す。
MESSAGE.EN: She got to her feet so hurriedly her chair toppled over.
MESSAGE.Translation: She got to her feet so hurriedly her chair toppled over.

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「わっ、わっ、わわわ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝Wa, wa, wawawa.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝Wa, wa, wawawa.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 教室に笑いが起きた。
MESSAGE.EN: The entire class burst into laughter,
MESSAGE.Translation: The entire class burst into laughter,

MESSAGE.JP: 僕と西園さんだけが笑わなかった。
MESSAGE.EN: except Nishizono-san and me.
MESSAGE.Translation: except Nishizono-san and me.

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「理樹、聞いたぞ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝Riki, I heard about something.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝Riki, I heard about something.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「なにかにエントリーするらしいじゃねぇか。オレも参戦するぜ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝You're gonna enter in some contest, aren't you? Count me in, too.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝You're gonna enter in some contest, aren't you? Count me in, too.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「え？　短歌一緒に作るの？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝What? You want to make tanka with us?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝What? You want to make tanka with us?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「たんか？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝Tanka?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝Tanka?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「そう。五・七・五の。それでもやるの？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Right. That 31 syllabled thing. Still interested?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Right. That 31 syllabled thing. Still interested?❞

MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝Oh...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝Oh...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「イテテ…考えたら…頭痛が…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝My head's... starting to... hurt...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝My head's... starting to... hurt...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「無理しないでよっ、真人の脳には荷が重すぎるよっ、このことは忘れて穏やかに暮らしていてよっ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Take it easy. That must be too painful for your brain. You'd better forget about it and live a peaceful life.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Take it easy. That must be too painful for your brain. You'd better forget about it and live a peaceful life.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「いやあ…オレはやるぜ…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝No... I'll do this...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝No... I'll do this...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「ものすごい汗だよっ、真人死んじゃうよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝You have beads of sweat on your face. You're gonna die, Masato.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝You have beads of sweat on your face. You're gonna die, Masato.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「謙吾にも参加させて…頭でもオレのほうが優れていることを示してやるっ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝I'll pull Kengo in, too... and prove that I'm smarter than him, not just stronger.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝I'll pull Kengo in, too... and prove that I'm smarter than him, not just stronger.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「すでにテストの点数で負け続けてるからっ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝You already get worse grades than him.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝You already get worse grades than him.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「じゃ、なおさらだ…今度こそは負けねぇ…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝Especially then... I must win this time...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝Especially then... I must win this time...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「直枝さんのご説明では言葉足らずだったので、わたしから」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Naoe-san didn't supply you all the necessary information, so let me add some more.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Naoe-san didn't supply you all the necessary information, so let me add some more.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「ああ…こいよ…耐えてみせるぜ…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝Okay... Bring it on... I will overcome it...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝Okay... Bring it on... I will overcome it...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「短歌は、上の句、五・七・五と下の句、七・七のリズムで歌われる和歌の形のひとつです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Tanka poetry is a form of waka, which consists of five units. The set of the first two ones is called the upper phrase, and the set of the other three is called the lower phrase.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Tanka poetry is a form of waka, which consists of five units. The set of the first two ones is called the upper phrase, and the set of the other three is called the lower phrase.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「和歌と短歌は違うの？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝What's the difference between tanka and waka?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝What's the difference between tanka and waka?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「一般的には同じですが、正確には、和歌には短歌と長歌の二種類があるんです。もっとも、現代では長歌はほとんど残っていません」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝They are generally the same. But technically, there are two kinds of waka. One is tanka, and the other is chouka. Actually, few chouka are left in the present day.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝They are generally the same. But technically, there are two kinds of waka. One is tanka, and the other is chouka. Actually, few chouka are left in the present day.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「なので、現在では和歌と短歌はほぼ同義と言って良いと思います」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝For that reason, you can say waka and tanka are almost synonymous.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝For that reason, you can say waka and tanka are almost synonymous.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「うぉぉおぉぉぉ…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝Uohhhhh...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝Uohhhhh...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「…お…終わったか？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝...Is... is it over?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝...Is... is it over?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「はい」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Yes.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Yes.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「やった…耐え抜いた…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝I did it... I overcame it...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝I did it... I overcame it...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「どうだい、理樹…オレはなかなかの戦力になるぜ？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝See Riki? I got what it takes to help you.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝See Riki? I got what it takes to help you.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「説明聞いただけでそんな勝ち誇った顔されても…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝You just heard a short explanation. You have nothing to be proud of...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝You just heard a short explanation. You have nothing to be proud of...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「ところで、なんでこのことを真人が知ってるの？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝How did you know about the contest, by the way?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝How did you know about the contest, by the way?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「そりゃ、恭介から聞いたからだ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝I heard from Kyousuke, of course.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝I heard from Kyousuke, of course.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「勝負、と聞いたからには参戦しないわけにはいかないだろう…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝When it comes to competition, I can't afford to ignore it...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝When it comes to competition, I can't afford to ignore it...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「謙吾も呼んでやる」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝I'll call Kengo.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝I'll call Kengo.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 太い指で携帯を操作し始めた。
MESSAGE.EN: He took his cellphone out of his pocket.
MESSAGE.Translation: He took his cellphone out of his pocket.

MESSAGE.JP: `謙吾@「やってやろう」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kengo@❝I accept the challenge.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kengo@❝I accept the challenge.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「へっ、勝負だっ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝All right, let's make it a good fight!❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝All right, let's make it a good fight!❞

MESSAGE.JP: `謙吾@「来てやったぞ。部活で忙しい中な。礼ぐらい言え」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kengo@❝I came all the way over here even though I was busy with the kendo club. Thank me.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kengo@❝I came all the way over here even though I was busy with the kendo club. Thank me.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「おっす！　ありがとうございます！」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝Yep! Thank you very much!❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝Yep! Thank you very much!❞

MESSAGE.JP: すでに勝負がついている気がする。
MESSAGE.EN: It seemed already obvious who the winner would be.
MESSAGE.Translation: It seemed already obvious who the winner would be.

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「わふー、棗さんからお聞きしましたよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝Wafuu～, Natsume-san told me about the contest.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝Wafuu～, Natsume-san told me about the contest.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「日本伝統のぽえむはだいすきですー。私も混ぜてくださいですっ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝I love traditional Japanese poetry. Please let me in!❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝I love traditional Japanese poetry. Please let me in!❞

MESSAGE.JP: `葉留佳@「なになに、面白そーじゃん」
MESSAGE.EN: `Haruka@❝Hey, hey, that sounds fun.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Haruka@❝Hey, hey, that sounds fun.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `来ヶ谷@「ふむ、私も入れてもらおうか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kurugaya@❝Umu, allow me to join as well.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kurugaya@❝Umu, allow me to join as well.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `小毬@「うん、みんなで一緒に考えよー」
MESSAGE.EN: `Komari@❝Yeah, let's make good ones together.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Komari@❝Yeah, let's make good ones together.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `鈴@「…やらないでもない」
MESSAGE.EN: `Rin@❝...I guess I can do that.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Rin@❝...I guess I can do that.❞

MESSAGE.JP: …結局、みんなで集まることになるのか。
MESSAGE.EN: ...In the end, the whole Little Busters gang had gathered.
MESSAGE.Translation: ...In the end, the whole Little Busters gang had gathered.

MESSAGE.JP: いつものメンバーが、教室の隅で固まる。
MESSAGE.EN: We occupied a corner of the classroom.
MESSAGE.Translation: We occupied a corner of the classroom.

MESSAGE.JP: `恭介@「とりあえずどうすればいいか、西園に説明してもらおうか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kyousuke@❝First of all, can you tell us what to do, Nishizono?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kyousuke@❝First of all, can you tell us what to do, Nishizono?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「は、はぁ…、とは言っても、わたしもうまく説明できるか、どうか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝O-okay... But I'm not quite sure if I can explain well.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝O-okay... But I'm not quite sure if I can explain well.❞

MESSAGE.JP: それから、こほんと咳払いをひとつ。
MESSAGE.EN: She cleared her throat.
MESSAGE.Translation: She cleared her throat.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「短歌には色々なものがありますが、要は五、七、五、七、七と形式の決まった詩です」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝There are a lot of tanka works out there, and the one thing you have to know about them is that they are all made of thirty one syllables.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝There are a lot of tanka works out there, and the one thing you have to know about them is that they are all made of thirty one syllables.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「歴史を逆のぼれば、『$K47古事記$K0』や『日本書紀』で既に歌謡の形式の一種として登場する短歌は、主に八世紀の後半になって編集された『$K54万葉集$K0』で大成を迎えます」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Tanka already appeared in the $K47Kojiki$K0 or the Nihon Shoki as a form of Japanese poetry. And it was perfected in $K54Man'yoshu$K0, which was edited in the late 8th century.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Tanka already appeared in the $K47Kojiki$K0 or the Nihon Shoki as a form of Japanese poetry. And it was perfected in $K54Man'yoshu$K0, which was edited in the late 8th century.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「その後、一時期は漢詩が主流になることがありますが、十世紀に入ると復活し…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝After that, Chinese style poetry became mainstream for a while, but tanka made a comeback in the 10th century.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝After that, Chinese style poetry became mainstream for a while, but tanka made a comeback in the 10th century.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「平安時代には『古今（こきん）和歌集』『後撰（ごせん）和歌集』『拾遺（しゅうい）和歌集』といった、いわゆる八代集が編まれ…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝In the Heian Period, a total of eight poetry collections, such as the Kokin Wakashu, Gosen Wakashu and Shui Wakashu, were edited.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝In the Heian Period, a total of eight poetry collections, such as the Kokin Wakashu, Gosen Wakashu and Shui Wakashu, were edited.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「$K38貴族$K0達の間で短歌は日本文学として一つの高みに達するのです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝It meant that tanka was highly appreciated among the $K38aristocracy$K0 back then.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝It meant that tanka was highly appreciated among the $K38aristocracy$K0 back then.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「しかしながら、$K41鎌倉時代$K0になり、武士が政権を執ると短歌は次第に停滞をしていきます」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝However, in the $K41Kamakura Period$K0, the samurai took over the government and tanka's popularity began to decline.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝However, in the $K41Kamakura Period$K0, the samurai took over the government and tanka's popularity began to decline.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `来ヶ谷@「ふむ、だが『$K72小倉百人一首$K0』ができたのは、ちょうどその頃ではないかな」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kurugaya@❝Hmm. But isn't it around that time that the $K72Ogura Hyakunin Isshu$K0 was completed?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kurugaya@❝Hmm. But isn't it around that time that the $K72Ogura Hyakunin Isshu$K0 was completed?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「確かにそうです。藤原定家が『小倉百人一首』を選んだのは今から、およそ八百年前ですから、鎌倉時代の初期ですね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝That's right. It was the early Kamakura Period, about 800 years ago, when Fujiwarano Sadaie selected the verses for the anthology.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝That's right. It was the early Kamakura Period, about 800 years ago, when Fujiwarano Sadaie selected the verses for the anthology.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「しかし、定家とその子、為家が亡くなり、$K63南北朝$K0の頃になると、短歌は形式主義に囚われるようになってしまいます」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝However, after he and his son, Tameie, died, and the $K63Nanboku-cho Period$K0 began, well-established norms dominated the whole of the tanka community.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝However, after he and his son, Tameie, died, and the $K63Nanboku-cho Period$K0 began, well-established norms dominated the whole of the tanka community.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「以後、公家達の間で脈々と続いてはいくのですが、新しい歌風が誕生することもなく、伝統に流されていくのでした」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝After that, tanka was losing ground among the aristocracy for a long time, but, in the meantime, the conventional styles stayed alive without any novel ones being established.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝After that, tanka was losing ground among the aristocracy for a long time, but, in the meantime, the conventional styles stayed alive without any novel ones being established.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「その流れが大きく変わったのが、$K59明治維新$K0です」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝The $K59Meiji Restoration$K0 changed that situation.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝The $K59Meiji Restoration$K0 changed that situation.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「それまで公家が中心であった短歌の世界に、様々な人が参加するようになり、自由と個性を求めるようになります」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Not only the aristocracy, but all kinds of people joined the tanka community, seeking both freedom and individuality.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Not only the aristocracy, but all kinds of people joined the tanka community, seeking both freedom and individuality.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「浪漫派の$K119与謝野鉄幹$K0、写生を訴えた正岡子規、がその代表でしょうか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝For example, $K119Yosano Tekkan$K0, the romanticist, and Masaoka Shiki, the realist.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝For example, $K119Yosano Tekkan$K0, the romanticist, and Masaoka Shiki, the realist.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「さらに、明治後期から大正にかけて耽美派の北原白秋…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Or Kitahara Hakushuu, who belonged to the aesthetic school from the late Meiji Period to the Taisho Period...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Or Kitahara Hakushuu, who belonged to the aesthetic school from the late Meiji Period to the Taisho Period...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「耽美派と言っても、いわゆる『お耽美』とは違い、浪漫派の流れを汲んだ新浪漫派とでも言うべきものです。期待すると、ちょっと残念です」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝You might be expecting ❛something else❜ when it comes to aestheticism, but you are to think of the ism as neo-romanticism. So you shouldn't get your hopes up.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝You might be expecting ❛something else❜ when it comes to aestheticism, but you are to think of the ism as neo-romanticism. So you shouldn't get your hopes up.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「ごめん…なにが『いわゆる』なのか全然分かんないよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Sorry... But I just don't get what you meant by ❛something else.❜❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Sorry... But I just don't get what you meant by ❛something else.❜❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「…そうですか。まあ、それはさておきまして、他にもこの時代にはプロレタリア短歌の先駆けとなる石川啄木、それから自然を歌った若山牧水らが登場します」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝I see. Well, that's not important. Many other poets appeared in the age: Ishikawa Takuboku, creator of the proletarian tanka, or Bokusui Wakayama, who was inspired by nature.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝I see. Well, that's not important. Many other poets appeared in the age: Ishikawa Takuboku, creator of the proletarian tanka, or Bokusui Wakayama, who was inspired by nature.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 若山牧水…。
MESSAGE.EN: Bokusui Wakayama...
MESSAGE.Translation: Bokusui Wakayama...

MESSAGE.JP: その名を口にした時、西園さんの口調がわずかに湿った気がした。
MESSAGE.EN: I noticed an affectionate spark in her tone of voice as she mentioned his name.
MESSAGE.Translation: I noticed an affectionate spark in her tone of voice as she mentioned his name.

MESSAGE.JP: 僕は嫌でも、あの歌を思い出すことになる。
MESSAGE.EN: I was again reminded of that tanka piece.
MESSAGE.Translation: I was again reminded of that tanka piece.

MESSAGE.JP: でも、西園さんは構わずに話を続けていた。
MESSAGE.EN: But her explanation still continued.
MESSAGE.Translation: But her explanation still continued.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「そして同人誌『アララギ』では、斎藤茂吉が写実派をさらに発展させますが、それを批判する人たちが反アララギとでも呼ぶべき動きを見せるようになり…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝And then while Saito Mokichi started the realism movement in the coterie magazine called ❛Araragi,❜ those who inveighed against it started the group called ❛anti-Araragi.❜❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝And then while Saito Mokichi started the realism movement in the coterie magazine called ❛Araragi,❜ those who inveighed against it started the group called ❛anti-Araragi.❜❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「アララギ対反アララギの対立は、その後の短歌の流れに大きな影響を与えることになりました」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝The conflict between those groups greatly influenced the latter tanka community.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝The conflict between those groups greatly influenced the latter tanka community.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 真人は白目を剥き、気絶していた。
MESSAGE.EN: Masato had passed out; the whites of his eyes were showing.
MESSAGE.Translation: Masato had passed out; the whites of his eyes were showing.

MESSAGE.JP: 葉留佳さんは居眠り…。
MESSAGE.EN: Haruka-san was taking a nap...
MESSAGE.Translation: Haruka-san was taking a nap...

MESSAGE.JP: こういうことに饒舌になるのは、西園さんらしいけど。
MESSAGE.EN: I did know Nishizono-san could become really verbose when it came to this kind of stuff.
MESSAGE.Translation: I did know Nishizono-san could become really verbose when it came to this kind of stuff.

MESSAGE.JP: このままでは、話が進まない。
MESSAGE.EN: Yet, there was something more important we had to learn.
MESSAGE.Translation: Yet, there was something more important we had to learn.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「ねえ、西園さん。短歌の歴史はまた今度でいいから、作り方だけ教えてくれれば」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Say, Nishizono-san. We learned enough tanka history, so can you please teach us how to write tanka next?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Say, Nishizono-san. We learned enough tanka history, so can you please teach us how to write tanka next?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「…そうですか。歴史を学ぶと、また新しい面白さが発見できますよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝...All right, but you can discover new, fun aspects by studying history.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝...All right, but you can discover new, fun aspects by studying history.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「それはそうかも知れないけど」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝That could be true.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝That could be true.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「ほら、短歌は『詩』なんでしょう？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝But tanka is poetry, isn't it?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝But tanka is poetry, isn't it?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「だったら、やっぱり大事なのは、何を表現するか、したいと思うか、なんじゃないかな」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝So I think what's more important is what you want to express or what you choose to express.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝So I think what's more important is what you want to express or what you choose to express.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「それは、歴史を知らなかったとしても、自然に心からわきあがるものだと思うよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝And that should be something you can do naturally even if you're unfamiliar with history.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝And that should be something you can do naturally even if you're unfamiliar with history.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `小毬@「うん、ポエムと一緒で大切なのはこころなんだね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Komari@❝Right. What's most important in poems is one's heart.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Komari@❝Right. What's most important in poems is one's heart.❞

MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝.........❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝.........❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「これから昭和、そして戦後と話が続くのですが…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝I was going to mention the Showa and Postwar Periods...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝I was going to mention the Showa and Postwar Periods...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「説明も非常に端折ったもので、細かい点を挙げていけばキリがないのですが…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝And there were a lot more details I'd like to cover...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝And there were a lot more details I'd like to cover...❞

MESSAGE.JP: そこで、舟を漕いでいる一部のメンバーに気づく。
MESSAGE.EN: She then noticed that certain members were nodding off.
MESSAGE.Translation: She then noticed that certain members were nodding off.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「…すみません、つい長話をし過ぎたようです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝...I'm sorry. It seems like my talk was too long.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝...I'm sorry. It seems like my talk was too long.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「そうですね、ひとまず、五、七、五、七、七の形式だけ頭に置いて、自由に作ってみると良いのではないでしょうか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝All right. To begin with, why don't we try freely composing poems with the 5-7-5-7-7?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝All right. To begin with, why don't we try freely composing poems with the 5-7-5-7-7?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「さすが詳しいですねぇ、西園さん。また続きを聞かせてほしいです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝You really know a lot, Nishizono-san. I'd like to hear more if possible.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝You really know a lot, Nishizono-san. I'd like to hear more if possible.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「あっ…はい、いつかまた」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Oh... Okay, maybe later.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Oh... Okay, maybe later.❞

MESSAGE.JP: しばらく、みんなが黙って考え込んでいる。
MESSAGE.EN: All of us pondered for a while in dead silence.
MESSAGE.Translation: All of us pondered for a while in dead silence.

MESSAGE.JP: クドや小毬さんは教室を歩き回って、なにか題材はないかと探しているみたいだ。
MESSAGE.EN: Kud and Komari-san were walking about the room, looking for some good inspiration for their works.
MESSAGE.Translation: Kud and Komari-san were walking about the room, looking for some good inspiration for their works.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「五、七、五、七、七、を忘れないでください」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Don't forget about the composition.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Don't forget about the composition.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 西園さんはアドバイスをして回っている。
MESSAGE.EN: She was moving around, instructing each of her students.
MESSAGE.Translation: She was moving around, instructing each of her students.

MESSAGE.JP: `葉留佳@「んー…そうだ！　思いついたことがあるんだけどさ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Haruka@❝Hmm... Oh yeah! I've got an idea.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Haruka@❝Hmm... Oh yeah! I've got an idea.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `葉留佳@「美魚ちん、五と七を組み合わせればいいんだよね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Haruka@❝Mio-chin, point is to mix up 5s and 7s, right?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Haruka@❝Mio-chin, point is to mix up 5s and 7s, right?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「はい、そうです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Yes, it is.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Yes, it is.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `葉留佳@「だったらさ、うーんとね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Haruka@❝Then, well.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Haruka@❝Then, well.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `葉留佳@「ノート貸してよ、理樹くん」
MESSAGE.EN: `Haruka@❝Lend me your notebook, Riki-kun?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Haruka@❝Lend me your notebook, Riki-kun?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「えっ、いいけど」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Eh, all right.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Eh, all right.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 鞄からノートを出して渡すと、左手にハサミを持った葉留佳さんがいきなりページを切り始める。
MESSAGE.EN: I pulled a notebook out of my bag and handed it over to her, and she promptly began cutting several pages off with her scissors.
MESSAGE.Translation: I pulled a notebook out of my bag and handed it over to her, and she promptly began cutting several pages off with her scissors.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「ちょ、ちょっと待ってよ。まだ使いかけなんだから」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Hey wait, I'm still using it.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Hey wait, I'm still using it.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `葉留佳@「だいじょぶ、じょぶ。問題ない影響ない心配ない」
MESSAGE.EN: `Haruka@❝That's okay, 'kay. No problem, no difference, no worry.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Haruka@❝That's okay, 'kay. No problem, no difference, no worry.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「何が心配ない、のさ…。もう手遅れだから、どっちでもいいけどさ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝What do you mean, no worry...? Well, whatever. Seems like it's too late.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝What do you mean, no worry...? Well, whatever. Seems like it's too late.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `葉留佳@「一人の尊い犠牲が、すぐれた作品を世に送り出すんだよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Haruka@❝Greatest of works are born from the greatest of sacrifices.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Haruka@❝Greatest of works are born from the greatest of sacrifices.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `葉留佳@「じゃーん」
MESSAGE.EN: `Haruka@❝Ta-da!❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Haruka@❝Ta-da!❞

MESSAGE.JP: 葉留佳さんの手元には、罫線の入ったままのノートの切れ端が短冊状に何枚も置かれていた。
MESSAGE.EN: On the desk in front of her were many reed-shaped pieces of paper.
MESSAGE.Translation: On the desk in front of her were many reed-shaped pieces of paper.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「いったい、何を？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝What are you planning to do with those papers?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝What are you planning to do with those papers?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `葉留佳@「はいはい、みんなこれ持って」
MESSAGE.EN: `Haruka@❝Here, here, everybody get one.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Haruka@❝Here, here, everybody get one.❞

MESSAGE.JP: そして、葉留佳さんは紙切れを配る。
MESSAGE.EN: She handed us one piece each.
MESSAGE.Translation: She handed us one piece each.

MESSAGE.JP: `来ヶ谷@「なるほど、ここに五、あるいは七の音を持つ言葉を書くわけだな」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kurugaya@❝I get it. Your idea is to write a sentence with five or seven syllables on it, right?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kurugaya@❝I get it. Your idea is to write a sentence with five or seven syllables on it, right?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `葉留佳@「さすが姉御ー。理解がはやくてたすかるヨ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Haruka@❝As expected of Anego! It helps that you figured it out so quickly.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Haruka@❝As expected of Anego! It helps that you figured it out so quickly.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「えーと、つまり…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝So, the idea is...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝So, the idea is...❞

MESSAGE.JP: みんなで五と七の言葉を書いて、それを適当に組み合わせよう、ということか。
MESSAGE.EN: Each of us would write one five or seven syllabled phrase and mix them up randomly... that must be what she's suggesting.
MESSAGE.Translation: Each of us would write one five or seven syllabled phrase and mix them up randomly... that must be what she's suggesting.

MESSAGE.JP: `葉留佳@「これぞ、リトルバスターズの合作だよね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Haruka@❝This style allows us Little Busters to create collaborative works.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Haruka@❝This style allows us Little Busters to create collaborative works.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `葉留佳@「おもしろそーでしょ？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Haruka@❝Sounds fun, doesn't it?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Haruka@❝Sounds fun, doesn't it?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「すっげぇ助かるぜっ、全部考えなくていいんだったらよっ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝That'll help a lot coz it's a pain in the neck doing everything by myself.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝That'll help a lot coz it's a pain in the neck doing everything by myself.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 勝負はどうした。
MESSAGE.EN: Hey, Masato, you're supposed to be competing with Kengo, aren't you?
MESSAGE.Translation: Hey, Masato, you're supposed to be competing with Kengo, aren't you?

MESSAGE.JP: 他のみんなも賛成の意を示す。
MESSAGE.EN: The other members except one all agreed with her idea.
MESSAGE.Translation: The other members except one all agreed with her idea.

MESSAGE.JP: みんなの視線が西園さんに向く。
MESSAGE.EN: And then they turned their eyes toward the holdout, Nishizono-san.
MESSAGE.Translation: And then they turned their eyes toward the holdout, Nishizono-san.

MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝.........❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝.........❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「合作、というのは面白そうですね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Collaborating... That sounds rather interesting.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Collaborating... That sounds rather interesting.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「…どのようなものになるか、非常に不安ではありますが」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝...In fact, I'm very anxious to see how it will turn out.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝...In fact, I'm very anxious to see how it will turn out.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `葉留佳@「あはは、じゃあ、美魚ちんもオッケーしてくれたし」
MESSAGE.EN: `Haruka@❝Ahaha, okay, Mio-chin OK's it.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Haruka@❝Ahaha, okay, Mio-chin OK's it.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `葉留佳@「早速、やってみよー」
MESSAGE.EN: `Haruka@❝Let's get it started.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Haruka@❝Let's get it started.❞

MESSAGE.JP: それぞれが一枚にひとつ、言葉を書く。
MESSAGE.EN: Each of us wrote words on papers.
MESSAGE.Translation: Each of us wrote words on papers.

MESSAGE.JP: それを五と七、に分けて集めて、机の上でかき混ぜる。
MESSAGE.EN: And we sorted them into stacks of five-syllabled and seven-syllabled ones, and shuffled both groups on desks.
MESSAGE.Translation: And we sorted them into stacks of five-syllabled and seven-syllabled ones, and shuffled both groups on desks.

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「まずは五、からだな」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝First, one from the fives.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝First, one from the fives.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 真人が紙を一枚選ぶ。
MESSAGE.EN: He picked up one from the five-syllabled group.
MESSAGE.Translation: He picked up one from the five-syllabled group.

MESSAGE.JP: 風光る
MESSAGE.EN: [In the blazing wind]
MESSAGE.Translation: [In the blazing wind]

MESSAGE.JP: `来ヶ谷@「ほう、存外まともなのがきたな」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kurugaya@❝Hoh, that has a rather good ring to it.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kurugaya@❝Hoh, that has a rather good ring to it.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 次は来ヶ谷さんが引く。
MESSAGE.EN: Kurugaya-san drew the next one out.
MESSAGE.Translation: Kurugaya-san drew the next one out.

MESSAGE.JP: あなたの傍に
MESSAGE.EN: [standing there right beside me]
MESSAGE.Translation: [standing there right beside me]

MESSAGE.JP: `来ヶ谷@「…普通だな。つまらん」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kurugaya@❝...Another decent one. Boring.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kurugaya@❝...Another decent one. Boring.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `小毬@「次は私だね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Komari@❝My turn.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Komari@❝My turn.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 君がいる
MESSAGE.EN: [here you are with me]
MESSAGE.Translation: [here you are with me]

MESSAGE.JP: …あれ、なんか自然な流れだ。
MESSAGE.EN: ...Oh, not bad combinations so far.
MESSAGE.Translation: ...Oh, not bad combinations so far.

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「えいっ！　私はなんでしょーか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝Ei! What's mine like?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝Ei! What's mine like?❞

MESSAGE.JP: 真っ赤なブルマ
MESSAGE.EN: [wearing those fierce red bloomers]
MESSAGE.Translation: [wearing those fierce red bloomers]

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「じゃあ、最後は僕が」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Okay, I'm last.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Okay, I'm last.❞

MESSAGE.JP: ぼく大巨人！
MESSAGE.EN: [my great big giant!]
MESSAGE.Translation: [my great big giant!]

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「続けて読むと…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Let's put them together...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Let's put them together...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「風光る　あなたの傍に　君がいる　真っ赤なブルマ　ぼく大巨人！」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝In the blazing wind, standing there right beside me, here you are with me, wearing those fierce red bloomers, my great big giant!❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝In the blazing wind, standing there right beside me, here you are with me, wearing those fierce red bloomers, my great big giant!❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「ですか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝That's it.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝That's it.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「そんな大巨人、見たくないよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝I don't want to see a great big giant in bloomers.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝I don't want to see a great big giant in bloomers.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「…最後に直枝さんが変な札を引くからです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝...That's all your fault. You picked out a weird one for the last.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝...That's all your fault. You picked out a weird one for the last.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「ちょっと待ってよ、クドが引いたブルマからして変だから」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Wait a sec. It started getting weird from Kud's turn.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Wait a sec. It started getting weird from Kud's turn.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「ていうか、やっぱりこんな形式じゃダメだよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Well, this style doesn't work all that well.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Well, this style doesn't work all that well.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `葉留佳@「そのようですネ…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Haruka@❝You're right...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Haruka@❝You're right...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「順番にひとりずつ五、七、五、七、七を考えていくとかにしない？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝What about this? We make up the phrases in turns, one by one.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝What about this? We make up the phrases in turns, one by one.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「それはどうやって決めるんだ？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝Who decides the order?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝Who decides the order?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「えーと、西園さんが」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Well, that would be Nishizono-san.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Well, that would be Nishizono-san.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「…そんな角が立つような真似はちょっと…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝...I'd rather not do something that could make people feel bad...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝...I'd rather not do something that could make people feel bad...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「…直枝さん、お願いします」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝...Naoe-san, you do it, please.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝...Naoe-san, you do it, please.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「あ、うん…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Uh, okay...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Uh, okay...❞

MESSAGE.JP: 僕の角が立つのはいいのか…。
MESSAGE.EN: Apparently she doesn't mind people feeling bad as long as I take the blame...
MESSAGE.Translation: Apparently she doesn't mind people feeling bad as long as I take the blame...

MESSAGE.JP: さて、じゃあ誰からにしよう。
MESSAGE.EN: Well, who should be first?
MESSAGE.Translation: Well, who should be first?

MESSAGE.JP: `葉留佳@「やー、案外、五文字や七文字の言葉を考えるのって難しいねえ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Haruka@❝Well, it's way harder than I thought to come up with phrases of suitable length.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Haruka@❝Well, it's way harder than I thought to come up with phrases of suitable length.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「…このやり方は失敗でした」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝...This approach was a failure.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝...This approach was a failure.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 結局、何もできないままに解散となるのだった。
MESSAGE.EN: Eventually the meeting was over without achieving any results.
MESSAGE.Translation: Eventually the meeting was over without achieving any results.

MESSAGE.JP: `恭介@「さて…久々に町に繰り出すが、誰か一緒にいくか？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kyousuke@❝Well... I'm going out to the town. Anybody wanna come along?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kyousuke@❝Well... I'm going out to the town. Anybody wanna come along?❞

MESSAGE.JP: 特に用はなかったけど、これからの予定もなかったから、思わず挙手してしまっていた。
MESSAGE.EN: I stood up since I didn't have any particular plans for the rest of the day.
MESSAGE.Translation: I stood up since I didn't have any particular plans for the rest of the day.

MESSAGE.JP: 続けて、真人も立ち上がる。
MESSAGE.EN: And Masato followed suit.
MESSAGE.Translation: And Masato followed suit.

MESSAGE.JP: `恭介@「鈴はいいのか？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kyousuke@❝What about you, Rin?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kyousuke@❝What about you, Rin?❞

MESSAGE.EN: `Rin@❝Hm...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Rin@❝Hm...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `鈴@「モンペチをひとつだけ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Rin@❝Get me one Mon Petit.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Rin@❝Get me one Mon Petit.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 言って、小さな財布から小銭を取り出して、恭介に渡す。
MESSAGE.EN: She counted out coins from her wallet and gave them to him.
MESSAGE.Translation: She counted out coins from her wallet and gave them to him.

MESSAGE.JP: `恭介@「オーケー」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kyousuke@❝Okay.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kyousuke@❝Okay.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 恭介が僕を見る。
MESSAGE.EN: Kyousuke looked at me.
MESSAGE.Translation: Kyousuke looked at me.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「じゃ、いこうか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Let's go then.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Let's go then.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「おう」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝Yeah.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝Yeah.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「ふぅ…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Phew...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Phew...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「恭介は、コミック欄しか見ないから、小学生みたいだったよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝You were only checking out the comic section. You looked just like a little child.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝You were only checking out the comic section. You looked just like a little child.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `恭介@「それは賛辞だな」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kyousuke@❝I take that as a compliment.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kyousuke@❝I take that as a compliment.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「で、買ったのは何？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝So, what did you buy?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝So, what did you buy?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `恭介@「学園革命スクレボの最新刊。おまえも知ってるだろ？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kyousuke@❝The latest volume of School Revolution Sukurebo. You know that one, right?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kyousuke@❝The latest volume of School Revolution Sukurebo. You know that one, right?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「タイトルだけね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Just the title.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Just the title.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `恭介@「すっげぇ面白いんだぜ？　その学園の生徒は、いろんな国や企業から送り込まれている諜報員なんだ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kyousuke@❝The plot's just awesome. All the students in the school come from different countries and companies.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kyousuke@❝The plot's just awesome. All the students in the school come from different countries and companies.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `恭介@「つまりは全員がどこかのスパイというわけだ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kyousuke@❝In fact, they are all spies.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kyousuke@❝In fact, they are all spies.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `恭介@「ただ、唯一主人公だけは、普通の生徒で、彼らの抗争に巻き込まれていくんだ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kyousuke@❝But only the protagonist is an ordinary guy, and he gets drawn into countless fights.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kyousuke@❝But only the protagonist is an ordinary guy, and he gets drawn into countless fights.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `恭介@「今は銃を手に戦っている。片時とも手放せない。もちろん授業中もだ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kyousuke@❝He's caught in a gunfight at the moment. Of course he always has his gun on him, even in class.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kyousuke@❝He's caught in a gunfight at the moment. Of course he always has his gun on him, even in class.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `恭介@「果たして国をも動かすほどの学園に秘められた謎とはなんなのか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kyousuke@❝What on earth are the secrets concealed within the school, which can affect even an entire country?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kyousuke@❝What on earth are the secrets concealed within the school, which can affect even an entire country?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `恭介@「今、その解明編に入ったところだ。わくわくするぜ…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kyousuke@❝The secrets are starting to emerge right now. I'm so excited...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kyousuke@❝The secrets are starting to emerge right now. I'm so excited...❞

MESSAGE.JP: 歩きながらに熱弁を振るう。
MESSAGE.EN: He launched into a heated explanation.
MESSAGE.Translation: He launched into a heated explanation.

MESSAGE.JP: なんて楽しそうに話すんだろう。その笑顔に見とれていた。
MESSAGE.EN: He was speaking so enthusiastically I couldn't help but look at his smiling face.
MESSAGE.Translation: He was speaking so enthusiastically I couldn't help but look at his smiling face.

MESSAGE.JP: `恭介@「な、面白そうだろ？　帰ったらすぐ貸してやるから、理樹も読めよ。な」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kyousuke@❝Sounds fun, right? I'll lend you the ones I already read when we get home. You'll be reading them, right?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kyousuke@❝Sounds fun, right? I'll lend you the ones I already read when we get home. You'll be reading them, right?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「あ、うん」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Uh, sure.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Uh, sure.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 歩き慣れた商店街は、いつもと同じ顔をしている。
MESSAGE.EN: The atmosphere in the shopping district was the same as it had always been as we walked along the shops.
MESSAGE.Translation: The atmosphere in the shopping district was the same as it had always been as we walked along the shops.

MESSAGE.JP: 本屋、ケーキ屋、洋服屋、雑貨屋。
MESSAGE.EN: Bookstore, pastry shop, tailor, general store.
MESSAGE.Translation: Bookstore, pastry shop, tailor, general store.

MESSAGE.JP: 代わり映えのしない店並びに、変わらない商品。
MESSAGE.EN: The same old shops and the same old stuff being sold.
MESSAGE.Translation: The same old shops and the same old stuff being sold.

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「…どうした？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝...What's wrong?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝...What's wrong?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「ううん、別に…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Nothing...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Nothing...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「恭介も変わらないね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Kyousuke hasn't changed, either.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Kyousuke hasn't changed, either.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `真人@「なんだそりゃ？　子供じみてるって話か？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Masato@❝What's your point? You mean how he still acts like a kid?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Masato@❝What's your point? You mean how he still acts like a kid?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「いや、独り言みたいなものだから気にしないで」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Well, never mind. Just talking to myself.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Well, never mind. Just talking to myself.❞

MESSAGE.JP: そんな会話さえ、以前にもしたような気がしてくる。
MESSAGE.EN: It almost felt like we had had such a conversation before, as well.
MESSAGE.Translation: It almost felt like we had had such a conversation before, as well.

MESSAGE.JP: すれ違う人の顔も、毎回同じなのかもしれない。
MESSAGE.EN: Even the faces of the passersby might be the same ones every time.
MESSAGE.Translation: Even the faces of the passersby might be the same ones every time.

MESSAGE.JP: `恭介@「…理樹、余計なことは考えるな」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kyousuke@❝...Riki, don't think about useless stuff.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kyousuke@❝...Riki, don't think about useless stuff.❞

MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Eh?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Eh?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `恭介@「おまえは、ただ前を向いていればいい」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kyousuke@❝All you must do is look forward.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kyousuke@❝All you must do is look forward.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `恭介@「前へと進め」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kyousuke@❝Just keep moving forward.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kyousuke@❝Just keep moving forward.❞

MESSAGE.JP: それも独り言のようなものだったのかもしれない。
MESSAGE.EN: Maybe he was in the habit of talking to himself, too.
MESSAGE.Translation: Maybe he was in the habit of talking to himself, too.

MESSAGE.JP: 僕も追及はしないでおく。
MESSAGE.EN: I didn't dare to ask him the meaning behind his words.
MESSAGE.Translation: I didn't dare to ask him the meaning behind his words.

MESSAGE.JP: しばらく、無言のまま歩き続けた。
MESSAGE.EN: We walked along in silence for a while.
MESSAGE.Translation: We walked along in silence for a while.

MESSAGE.JP: 夕暮れの商店街は、買い物の親子連れや学生たちでにぎわっている。
MESSAGE.EN: The shopping street, colored by the rays of the setting sun, was crowded with students and families of parents and children.
MESSAGE.Translation: The shopping street, colored by the rays of the setting sun, was crowded with students and families of parents and children.

MESSAGE.JP: すれ違った瞬間には、顔を忘れてしまいそうな人の群れ。
MESSAGE.EN: A throng of people whose faces I might forget even as I pass them by.
MESSAGE.Translation: A throng of people whose faces I might forget even as I pass them by.

MESSAGE.JP: そのそれぞれに名前があり、家族がいて、生活があるとはどうしても信じられない。
MESSAGE.EN: It just felt hard to believe that each and every one of them really had a name, family and life of their own.
MESSAGE.Translation: It just felt hard to believe that each and every one of them really had a name, family and life of their own.

MESSAGE.JP: サラリーマン風の若い男性が歩いてくる。スーツにネクタイという無個性な服装からは、彼の歩む人生の想像もつかない。
MESSAGE.EN: There was a young salaryman crossing over from the opposite side. From his impersonal suit and necktie, I couldn't get any particular sense of how he had lived his life until now.
MESSAGE.Translation: There was a young salaryman crossing over from the opposite side. From his impersonal suit and necktie, I couldn't get any particular sense of how he had lived his life until now.

MESSAGE.JP: でも制服に身を包む僕らもまた、彼から見たら同じなんだろう。
MESSAGE.EN: But the same would've held true for him: he wouldn't be able to figure out anything about my life from my appearance.
MESSAGE.Translation: But the same would've held true for him: he wouldn't be able to figure out anything about my life from my appearance.

MESSAGE.JP: 僕は生きている。
MESSAGE.EN: I live.
MESSAGE.Translation: I live.

MESSAGE.JP: きっと、他の誰もがみな。
MESSAGE.EN: So do the others.
MESSAGE.Translation: So do the others.

MESSAGE.JP: 商店街の人の群れ。
MESSAGE.EN: The crowd in the shopping street.
MESSAGE.Translation: The crowd in the shopping street.

MESSAGE.JP: その中に――知っている顔を見つけた。
MESSAGE.EN: Among them I found a familiar face.
MESSAGE.Translation: Among them I found a familiar face.

MESSAGE.JP: 闇に浮かび上がる光のように。
MESSAGE.EN: As if seeing a sliver of light shining in darkness.
MESSAGE.Translation: As if seeing a sliver of light shining in darkness.

MESSAGE.JP: 休み時間、教室の喧噪の中で、その人の声だけがはっきりと耳に届くように。
MESSAGE.EN: As if singling out one particular individual's voice in a noisy classroom at recess.
MESSAGE.Translation: As if singling out one particular individual's voice in a noisy classroom at recess.

MESSAGE.JP: 人混みの中で、僕は確かに彼女の顔を捉えることができた。
MESSAGE.EN: It was a face I would be sure to recognize in a crowd.
MESSAGE.Translation: It was a face I would be sure to recognize in a crowd.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「…西園さん？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝...Nishizono-san?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝...Nishizono-san?❞

MESSAGE.JP: 僕らの距離は離れていたけど、確かにお互いに目が合ったと思った。
MESSAGE.EN: Although we were rather far from each other, I was sure that my eyes met hers.
MESSAGE.Translation: Although we were rather far from each other, I was sure that my eyes met hers.

MESSAGE.JP: でも、西園さんの姿は人混みにまぎれてすぐに消えてしまった。
MESSAGE.EN: However, her figure was soon engulfed in the crowd.
MESSAGE.Translation: However, her figure was soon engulfed in the crowd.

MESSAGE.JP: 後には、それまでと同じ街並みだけが残された。
MESSAGE.EN: And all that was left was the same busy street I've seen a hundred times.
MESSAGE.Translation: And all that was left was the same busy street I've seen a hundred times.

MESSAGE.JP: 僕に気づかなかったのだろうか。…そうは思えないけれど。
MESSAGE.EN: She must have noticed me...
MESSAGE.Translation: She must have noticed me...

MESSAGE.JP: …どこか、違和感があった。
MESSAGE.EN: ...Something was wrong.
MESSAGE.Translation: ...Something was wrong.

MESSAGE.JP: `恭介@「西園がどうかしたのか？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kyousuke@❝What's that about Nishizono?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kyousuke@❝What's that about Nishizono?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「さっき、あの辺りに…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝I think I saw her over there...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝I think I saw her over there...❞

MESSAGE.JP: 西園さんの姿を見た街角を指さす。
MESSAGE.EN: I pointed at where she should have been.
MESSAGE.Translation: I pointed at where she should have been.

MESSAGE.JP: `恭介@「ん？　気づかなかったな。買い物か何かか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kyousuke@❝Huh? Didn't notice. She must've been shopping or something, I suppose.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kyousuke@❝Huh? Didn't notice. She must've been shopping or something, I suppose.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「西園さんも一緒の本屋にいたのかな」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝I wonder if she was at the bookstore we went to.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝I wonder if she was at the bookstore we went to.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `恭介@「…かもしれないな」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kyousuke@❝...Could be.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kyousuke@❝...Could be.❞

MESSAGE.JP: そうして、僕らは帰途に着いた。
MESSAGE.EN: After that, we headed back home.
MESSAGE.Translation: After that, we headed back home.

MESSAGE.JP: 幽（かす）かに白くなる窓の外の淡い光を意識の端に感じながら、僕は…ぼんやりと考えていた。
MESSAGE.EN: I had the slight feeling of a white, feeble light coming from outside the window, as I was vaguely thinking about something.
MESSAGE.Translation: I had the slight feeling of a white, feeble light coming from outside the window, as I was vaguely thinking about something.

MESSAGE.JP: 昔、僕はひとりだった。
MESSAGE.EN: I used to be alone.
MESSAGE.Translation: I used to be alone.

MESSAGE.JP: 恭介が、真人が、謙吾が、鈴が、僕をすくい上げた。
MESSAGE.EN: At that time, Kyousuke, Masato, Kengo, and Rin had helped me out.
MESSAGE.Translation: At that time, Kyousuke, Masato, Kengo, and Rin had helped me out.

MESSAGE.JP: リトルバスターズ。
MESSAGE.EN: The Little Busters.
MESSAGE.Translation: The Little Busters.

MESSAGE.JP: それは、僕ら５人を象徴してきた名前だ。
MESSAGE.EN: That was the name that symbolized the five of us.
MESSAGE.Translation: That was the name that symbolized the five of us.

MESSAGE.JP: この春、恭介の気まぐれからメンバーが増えた。
MESSAGE.EN: Since this spring, many new members had joined on Kyousuke's whim.
MESSAGE.Translation: Since this spring, many new members had joined on Kyousuke's whim.

MESSAGE.JP: 小毬さん、来ヶ谷さん、クド、葉留佳さん、そして西園さん。
MESSAGE.EN: Komari-san, Kurugaya-san, Kud, Haruka-san, and Nishizono-san.
MESSAGE.Translation: Komari-san, Kurugaya-san, Kud, Haruka-san, and Nishizono-san.

MESSAGE.JP: 僕の世界は広がっていく。
MESSAGE.EN: My world was getting larger and larger.
MESSAGE.Translation: My world was getting larger and larger.

MESSAGE.JP: 広がって、そして…拡散していく。
MESSAGE.EN: It was spreading wider and wider.
MESSAGE.Translation: It was spreading wider and wider.

MESSAGE.JP: あれは中学の時だった。
MESSAGE.EN: It was during junior-high school.
MESSAGE.Translation: It was during junior-high school.

MESSAGE.JP: 『直枝ってひとりじゃ何もできないんだな』
MESSAGE.EN: ❝You can't do anything by yourself, Naoe.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: ❝You can't do anything by yourself, Naoe.❞

MESSAGE.JP: そう言われたことがある。
MESSAGE.EN: A certain boy said it to me.
MESSAGE.Translation: A certain boy said it to me.

MESSAGE.JP: 恭介を嫌う奴だった。
MESSAGE.EN: He hated Kyousuke.
MESSAGE.Translation: He hated Kyousuke.

MESSAGE.JP: 僕らは目立っていたから、目の仇にされることも時にはあった。
MESSAGE.EN: There were often people who despised us because of our flamboyance.
MESSAGE.Translation: There were often people who despised us because of our flamboyance.

MESSAGE.JP: …それは今も変わらないか。
MESSAGE.EN: ...No, that fact hasn't changed even now.
MESSAGE.Translation: ...No, that fact hasn't changed even now.

MESSAGE.JP: 『金魚の糞みたいに棗たちに引っついて歩くだけだな』
MESSAGE.EN: ❝All you do is follow Natsume all the time.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: ❝All you do is follow Natsume all the time.❞

MESSAGE.JP: その言葉に、僕は反論しなかった。
MESSAGE.EN: I didn't respond.
MESSAGE.Translation: I didn't respond.

MESSAGE.JP: いや、むしろ肯定したいくらいだった。
MESSAGE.EN: In fact, I agreed with him.
MESSAGE.Translation: In fact, I agreed with him.

MESSAGE.JP: みんなと一緒であることを僕は誇りに思っていたから。
MESSAGE.EN: I was proud of being with them.
MESSAGE.Translation: I was proud of being with them.

MESSAGE.JP: 僕は『誰か』とともにあることで、僕自身を知る。
MESSAGE.EN: I understand myself through my connection with others.
MESSAGE.Translation: I understand myself through my connection with others.

MESSAGE.JP: 僕が直枝理樹という個人であることを、定義する。
MESSAGE.EN: I identify myself as an individual named Riki Naoe.
MESSAGE.Translation: I identify myself as an individual named Riki Naoe.

MESSAGE.JP: でも…西園さんは違うのだろうか。
MESSAGE.EN: But... Nishizono-san seems different.
MESSAGE.Translation: But... Nishizono-san seems different.

MESSAGE.JP: 真にひとりであることを、願っている。
MESSAGE.EN: She longs to be truly alone.
MESSAGE.Translation: She longs to be truly alone.

MESSAGE.JP: 不変であることを、望んでいる。
MESSAGE.EN: She strongly desires to remain immutable.
MESSAGE.Translation: She strongly desires to remain immutable.

MESSAGE.JP: 染まることのない、白鳥のように。
MESSAGE.EN: Just like a swan, refusing to be colored.
MESSAGE.Translation: Just like a swan, refusing to be colored.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「もう、食べ終わったんだ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Finish eating already?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Finish eating already?❞

MESSAGE.JP: いつもと同じ時間に、中庭に向かう。
MESSAGE.EN: I visited the courtyard at the same time as every other day.
MESSAGE.Translation: I visited the courtyard at the same time as every other day.

MESSAGE.JP: 西園さんは、これまでと同じように木の下にいたけれど。
MESSAGE.EN: She was there under the tree, just as she always had.
MESSAGE.Translation: She was there under the tree, just as she always had.

MESSAGE.JP: 今日は、お弁当も本も広げていなかった。
MESSAGE.EN: But she was neither eating her bento nor reading a book.
MESSAGE.Translation: But she was neither eating her bento nor reading a book.

MESSAGE.JP: 日傘をたたんだまま、木に寄り添うように立っていた。
MESSAGE.EN: She was just standing next to the tree with her parasol closed.
MESSAGE.Translation: She was just standing next to the tree with her parasol closed.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「いえ、まだです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝No, not yet.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝No, not yet.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 首を振る。
MESSAGE.EN: She shook her head.
MESSAGE.Translation: She shook her head.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「お弁当は？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Where's your lunch?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Where's your lunch?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「…今日は、持ってきていません」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝...I didn't bring one today.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝...I didn't bring one today.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「何か買ってこようか？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Want me to go get some food?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Want me to go get some food?❞

MESSAGE.JP: 鳩たちが、えさをもらえないものかと僕らのことを遠巻きに見ている。
MESSAGE.EN: Pigeons were staring at us from a distance, wondering if we were going to feed them.
MESSAGE.Translation: Pigeons were staring at us from a distance, wondering if we were going to feed them.

MESSAGE.JP: 初めの頃はどれも同じにしか見えなかったけど、実は一羽ずつ模様が違っていて、最近では区別が付くようになってきた。
MESSAGE.EN: At first they had all looked alike to me, but I could now tell one from another because I had found the small differences that set each apart.
MESSAGE.Translation: At first they had all looked alike to me, but I could now tell one from another because I had found the small differences that set each apart.

MESSAGE.JP: 鈴じゃないけど、名前でも付けてみようかと思うくらいに。
MESSAGE.EN: It wouldn't be bad to name each of them the way Rin does her cats.
MESSAGE.Translation: It wouldn't be bad to name each of them the way Rin does her cats.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「あいつらも待ってるみたいだし」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Looks like they're waiting.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Looks like they're waiting.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「…仕方ありませんね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝In that case...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝In that case...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「お願いできますか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝...would you please?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝...would you please?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「任せてよ。サンドイッチでいいかな」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Sure thing. Are sandwiches fine?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Sure thing. Are sandwiches fine?❞

MESSAGE.JP: こくり、と頷く西園さんに念を押す。
MESSAGE.EN: I asked Nishizono-san, who nodded.
MESSAGE.Translation: I asked Nishizono-san, who nodded.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「ここで待っててよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Stay here until I'm back, all right?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Stay here until I'm back, all right?❞

MESSAGE.JP: 西園さんは少し寂しそうな笑顔で応えた。
MESSAGE.EN: She gave a somewhat lonely smile as confirmation.
MESSAGE.Translation: She gave a somewhat lonely smile as confirmation.

MESSAGE.JP: 急いで購買でふたり分のサンドイッチを買ってくる。
MESSAGE.EN: I hurried down to the school store and picked up sandwiches for two.
MESSAGE.Translation: I hurried down to the school store and picked up sandwiches for two.

MESSAGE.JP: 出遅れたせいで、あまり大したものは残っていなかった。
MESSAGE.EN: Due to my late start, there wasn't much left on the shelves.
MESSAGE.Translation: Due to my late start, there wasn't much left on the shelves.

MESSAGE.JP: なんでフルーツサンドって人気ないんだろう。
MESSAGE.EN: Why were fruit sandwiches always so unpopular?
MESSAGE.Translation: Why were fruit sandwiches always so unpopular?

MESSAGE.JP: 西園さんは木にもたれたまま、待っていた。
MESSAGE.EN: Nishizono-san was waiting for me, still leaning on the tree.
MESSAGE.Translation: Nishizono-san was waiting for me, still leaning on the tree.

MESSAGE.JP: 食べる時も、その姿勢だった。
MESSAGE.EN: She refused to sit down even while eating.
MESSAGE.Translation: She refused to sit down even while eating.

MESSAGE.JP: 西園さんが立っているのに、自分だけ腰掛けるのも変だったから僕も立ったまま食べている。
MESSAGE.EN: I also ate my lunch on my feet since I'd feel uncomfortable if I was the only one sitting.
MESSAGE.Translation: I also ate my lunch on my feet since I'd feel uncomfortable if I was the only one sitting.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「やっぱり、西園さんの手作りの方が美味しいね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝I prefer your sandwiches to these.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝I prefer your sandwiches to these.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 水気のないパンは、ぱさぱさと口の中に張り付く。
MESSAGE.EN: The bread lacked moisture and made the inside of my mouth feel dry.
MESSAGE.Translation: The bread lacked moisture and made the inside of my mouth feel dry.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「…そうですか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝...You do?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝...You do?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「明日は作ってきてくれるよね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Can you make some tomorrow?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Can you make some tomorrow?❞

MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝.........❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝.........❞

MESSAGE.JP: てっきり、直枝さんのために作ってるんじゃありませんって言われると思ったんだけどな。
MESSAGE.EN: I expected that she would say something like ❛It's not like I make the sandwiches for you, Naoe-san.❜
MESSAGE.Translation: I expected that she would say something like ❛It's not like I make the sandwiches for you, Naoe-san.❜

MESSAGE.JP: 西園さんは黙ったままだった。
MESSAGE.EN: But she said nothing.
MESSAGE.Translation: But she said nothing.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「昨日はあれからどこかに出かけたの？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Where did you go yesterday?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Where did you go yesterday?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「…なんのことですか？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝...What are you talking about?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝...What are you talking about?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「商店街にいたでしょう？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Weren't you in the shopping district?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Weren't you in the shopping district?❞

MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝.........❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝.........❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「いいえ、出かけてませんけど」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝No, I didn't go out.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝No, I didn't go out.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「そう…じゃあ、見間違いだったのかな」
