MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Oh... I must have have been mistaken then.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Oh... I must have have been mistaken then.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 目が合った時に、微笑んでくれたような気がしたのに。
MESSAGE.EN: But I thought she had smiled at me when our eyes had met.
MESSAGE.Translation: But I thought she had smiled at me when our eyes had met.

MESSAGE.JP: ちょっと残念だ。
MESSAGE.EN: I felt a pang of regret that it wasn't her.
MESSAGE.Translation: I felt a pang of regret that it wasn't her.

MESSAGE.JP: 不意に、あの時の違和感を思い出す。
MESSAGE.EN: I suddenly remembered that awkward feeling I'd gotten at that time.
MESSAGE.Translation: I suddenly remembered that awkward feeling I'd gotten at that time.

MESSAGE.JP: ――ああ、そうか。
MESSAGE.EN: ――Ah.
MESSAGE.Translation: ――Ah.

MESSAGE.JP: そして、その違和感の正体に思い至る。
MESSAGE.EN: I just realized what had caused the feeling of incongruity.
MESSAGE.Translation: I just realized what had caused the feeling of incongruity.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「日傘をしてなかったんだ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝She didn't have a parasol.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝She didn't have a parasol.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「えっ？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝What?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝What?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「昨日、西園さんを見かけたと思ったんだけど」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝The girl who I mistook for you yesterday.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝The girl who I mistook for you yesterday.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「そういえば、日傘を差していなかったよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝She didn't have a parasol.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝She didn't have a parasol.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「やっぱり、見間違えだったね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝So yeah, it was my mistake after all.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝So yeah, it was my mistake after all.❞

MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝.........❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝.........❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「その人は、そんなにわたしに似ていましたか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Did she bear such a strong resemblance to me?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Did she bear such a strong resemblance to me?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「うん」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Yeah.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Yeah.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 僕としては終わった話題のつもりだったのに、西園さんはしつこかった。
MESSAGE.EN: She was rather persistent even though I thought that would be the end of it.
MESSAGE.Translation: She was rather persistent even though I thought that would be the end of it.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「…どこか、違うところはありませんでしたか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝...Were there any differences between me and her?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝...Were there any differences between me and her?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「その、日傘以外にも」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝I mean, apart from the parasol.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝I mean, apart from the parasol.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「ちらっと見ただけだから、何とも言えないけど」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝I couldn't tell exactly, since it was a really quick glance.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝I couldn't tell exactly, since it was a really quick glance.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「言われてみれば、雰囲気が違ったような…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝But her demeanor was a little different from yours...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝But her demeanor was a little different from yours...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「どのように、ですか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Different in what way?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Different in what way?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「西園さんが、見せたことのないような…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝She gave me...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝She gave me...❞

MESSAGE.JP: 続ける言葉を少しためらう。
MESSAGE.EN: I hesitated to finish the sentence.
MESSAGE.Translation: I hesitated to finish the sentence.

MESSAGE.JP: でも、結局は言ってしまった。
MESSAGE.EN: But I ended up letting the words out, nevertheless.
MESSAGE.Translation: But I ended up letting the words out, nevertheless.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「笑顔をしていたよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝A kind of smile you've never showed me.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝A kind of smile you've never showed me.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「そう、ですか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝I... see.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝I... see.❞

MESSAGE.JP: それきり、西園さんはしゃべらなかった。
MESSAGE.EN: After that, she said nothing more.
MESSAGE.Translation: After that, she said nothing more.

MESSAGE.JP: 僕らは黙々と残りのサンドイッチを食べることになった。
MESSAGE.EN: We ate the rest of the lunch in silence.
MESSAGE.Translation: We ate the rest of the lunch in silence.

MESSAGE.JP: ぶしつけな言葉に怒ってしまったのか、とも思ったけれど。
MESSAGE.EN: I thought my blunt remark must have made her indignant.
MESSAGE.Translation: I thought my blunt remark must have made her indignant.

MESSAGE.JP: 西園さんは怒っているようには見えなかった。
MESSAGE.EN: But she didn't appear to be angry.
MESSAGE.Translation: But she didn't appear to be angry.

MESSAGE.JP: 僕の隣にいるのに、西園さんはどこか遠くを見て、微かに笑みすら浮かべていた。
MESSAGE.EN: Although I was right next to her, her eyes had a faraway look to them; there was even a small trace of a smile on her face.
MESSAGE.Translation: Although I was right next to her, her eyes had a faraway look to them; there was even a small trace of a smile on her face.

MESSAGE.JP: 予鈴が鳴る。
MESSAGE.EN: The bell rang.
MESSAGE.Translation: The bell rang.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「…そろそろ、戻りましょう」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝...Let's get back.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝...Let's get back.❞

MESSAGE.JP: そして、日傘を手に取って、先に歩いていった。
MESSAGE.EN: She picked up her parasol and walked on ahead of me.
MESSAGE.Translation: She picked up her parasol and walked on ahead of me.

MESSAGE.JP: 教室は放課後を迎える。
MESSAGE.EN: After school, in the classroom.
MESSAGE.Translation: After school, in the classroom.

MESSAGE.JP: さて、昨日に続いて短歌作りなんだけど…。
MESSAGE.EN: Now then, we were supposed to continue making the tanka poems...
MESSAGE.Translation: Now then, we were supposed to continue making the tanka poems...

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「西園さん、今日はどうする？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Nishizono-san, are you going to do it?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Nishizono-san, are you going to do it?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「どうする？　と言いますと」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝What are you asking me such a question for?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝What are you asking me such a question for?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「…直枝さんはやらないんですか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝...Are you not going to, Naoe-san?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝...Are you not going to, Naoe-san?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「西園さんこそ、どうかなって思ったんだけど…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝I merely wanted to confirm your commitment...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝I merely wanted to confirm your commitment...❞

MESSAGE.JP: 昼間の様子はちょっと変だった。
MESSAGE.EN: She had acted unusual at lunchtime.
MESSAGE.Translation: She had acted unusual at lunchtime.

MESSAGE.JP: それは僕がおかしなことを言ったせいでもある。
MESSAGE.EN: It was partly because of my thoughtless statement.
MESSAGE.Translation: It was partly because of my thoughtless statement.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「もちろん、やりますよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Needless to say, I'm going to do it.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Needless to say, I'm going to do it.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「約束は違えたくありませんから」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Because I don't want to break my word.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Because I don't want to break my word.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「だったらさ、今日は外に出てみない？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Then why don't we go outside today?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Then why don't we go outside today?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「教室の中で考えていても、うまくいかないんじゃないかなあ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝I think being indoors is a bit stifling for creativity.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝I think being indoors is a bit stifling for creativity.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 教室には、真人や謙吾、それに女の子たちの姿はない。
MESSAGE.EN: There weren't any other Little Busters members left in the classroom.
MESSAGE.Translation: There weren't any other Little Busters members left in the classroom.

MESSAGE.JP: 一日で飽きてしまったんだろうか。
MESSAGE.EN: Were they already tired of this?
MESSAGE.Translation: Were they already tired of this?

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「頭の中で色々な世界を妄想して、それを歌にするのもひとつの作り方です」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝You can make a poem by creating various kinds of worlds inside your own head.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝You can make a poem by creating various kinds of worlds inside your own head.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「空想の中でのみ得られる、この現実にはあり得ない美しさ、というものは確かにあります」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝There is, without a doubt, otherworldly beauty that you can only find within the realm of imagination.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝There is, without a doubt, otherworldly beauty that you can only find within the realm of imagination.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「本を読んでいる時にだけ現れる、もうひとつの現実のように、です」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝It's exactly like the kind of reality you experience when reading a book.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝It's exactly like the kind of reality you experience when reading a book.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「でも、同じ考えるにしても、もっと景色の良いところの方が良いかも知れませんね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝But I agree with you. A better backdrop can make you more imaginative.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝But I agree with you. A better backdrop can make you more imaginative.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「う、うん。きっと、そうだよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Y-yes. I think so too.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Y-yes. I think so too.❞

MESSAGE.JP: …そんな難しいことは考えてなかったけど。
MESSAGE.EN: ...I didn't think about it so deeply.
MESSAGE.Translation: ...I didn't think about it so deeply.

MESSAGE.JP: 西園さんがその気になってくれたなら、僕はそれだけで嬉しい。
MESSAGE.EN: But I was pleased to see her so motivated by my suggestion.
MESSAGE.Translation: But I was pleased to see her so motivated by my suggestion.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「じゃあ、早速行こうか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Let's go, then.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Let's go, then.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 昨日、僕はこの辺りで西園さんによく似た少女を見かけた。
MESSAGE.EN: Around here was where I saw the girl who resembled Nishizono-san yesterday.
MESSAGE.Translation: Around here was where I saw the girl who resembled Nishizono-san yesterday.

MESSAGE.JP: あれは僕の見間違いだったんだろうか。
MESSAGE.EN: Did I simply get the wrong person?
MESSAGE.Translation: Did I simply get the wrong person?

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「どうかしたんですか？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝What's the matter?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝What's the matter?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「う、ううん。別になんでもないよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Never mind. It's nothing.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Never mind. It's nothing.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「そう、ですか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Okay.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Okay.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 自分でも気づかないうちに、きょろきょろしていたみたいだ。
MESSAGE.EN: It seemed that I had been unconsciously looking around.
MESSAGE.Translation: It seemed that I had been unconsciously looking around.

MESSAGE.JP: 涼やかな風が川べりから流れてくる。
MESSAGE.EN: A cool breeze was blowing along the riverside.
MESSAGE.Translation: A cool breeze was blowing along the riverside.

MESSAGE.JP: 時折、強い風が吹くと、西園さんの持つ日傘が細やかに揺れる。
MESSAGE.EN: Occasionally strong gusts tugged on her parasol.
MESSAGE.Translation: Occasionally strong gusts tugged on her parasol.

MESSAGE.JP: しばらく雨が降っていないせいで、川の水量は幾分少ない。
MESSAGE.EN: The water level in the river was lower than usual due to a recent lack of rain.
MESSAGE.Translation: The water level in the river was lower than usual due to a recent lack of rain.

MESSAGE.JP: 僕らは堤防に腰かける。
MESSAGE.EN: We sat down on the levee.
MESSAGE.Translation: We sat down on the levee.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「学校のすぐ傍で、自然があるって言うとこの辺りかなあ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝I guess this is the only place with nature right near the school.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝I guess this is the only place with nature right near the school.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「確かに気持ちいいです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝It does feel very comfortable here.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝It does feel very comfortable here.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「中庭も緑が多くて、捨てがたいですが、たまには気分を変えるのも悪くありませんね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝I'm fond of that courtyard with its greenery, but I must say this place doesn't rank far behind it.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝I'm fond of that courtyard with its greenery, but I must say this place doesn't rank far behind it.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「ここで本を読んでも、きっと素敵でしょう」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝I'm sure it'd be lovely to read books here.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝I'm sure it'd be lovely to read books here.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「だけど、今日は別のことをしなくちゃね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝But we have something else to do today.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝But we have something else to do today.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「そう、ですね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Yes, we do.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Yes, we do.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 西園さんが差し掛ける傘の作る影が僕の体を包む。
MESSAGE.EN: I was covered by the shadow of the parasol she was holding up.
MESSAGE.Translation: I was covered by the shadow of the parasol she was holding up.

MESSAGE.JP: 夕暮れ前という時間、さらにはその影が僕が見るものすべてをぼんやりとさせる。
MESSAGE.EN: Because of that shadow and this pre-dusk light, everything felt a bit hazy to me.
MESSAGE.Translation: Because of that shadow and this pre-dusk light, everything felt a bit hazy to me.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「でも、ここで短歌が作れるかな」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝But I wonder, can we really make a good tanka poem here?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝But I wonder, can we really make a good tanka poem here?❞

MESSAGE.JP: 水音に負けず聞こえてくる道路を行き交う車の音、河原で遊ぶ子供たちの笑い声。
MESSAGE.EN: Apart from the sound of flowing water, there were also the cars driving down the nearby road and kids laughing while playing on the bank.
MESSAGE.Translation: Apart from the sound of flowing water, there were also the cars driving down the nearby road and kids laughing while playing on the bank.

MESSAGE.JP: 静かとは言い難い。
MESSAGE.EN: It was far from peace and quiet.
MESSAGE.Translation: It was far from peace and quiet.

MESSAGE.JP: 乱雑に広がる街並みも、景色が良いとは言えないだろう。
MESSAGE.EN: Plus, random buildings sticking out like a sore thumb somewhat diminished the value of the view.
MESSAGE.Translation: Plus, random buildings sticking out like a sore thumb somewhat diminished the value of the view.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「直枝さん…たとえば、『百人一首』で最も多く歌われている題材はなんだと思いますか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Naoe-san... What do you think was the most used subject for works in the Hyakunin Isshu?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Naoe-san... What do you think was the most used subject for works in the Hyakunin Isshu?❞

MESSAGE.JP: 僕の言葉に答えず、西園さんはそんなことを訊いてくる。
MESSAGE.EN: Instead of answering my question, she asked me one.
MESSAGE.Translation: Instead of answering my question, she asked me one.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「うーん、なんだろう…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Hmm, let me guess...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Hmm, let me guess...❞

MESSAGE.JP: 今までの話の流れだと…。
MESSAGE.EN: Considering the flow of the conversation we had so far...
MESSAGE.Translation: Considering the flow of the conversation we had so far...

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「自然の美しさ、かな」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝The beauty of nature, perhaps?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝The beauty of nature, perhaps?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「残念、はずれです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Too bad, no cigar.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Too bad, no cigar.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 口元に笑みを浮かべて、答えを教えてくれた。
MESSAGE.EN: She told me the answer with a faint smile.
MESSAGE.Translation: She told me the answer with a faint smile.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「それは、恋の歌です」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝It's love.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝It's love.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「恋…恋っていうと、男と女の間の恋？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Love... You mean the sort between a man and a woman?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Love... You mean the sort between a man and a woman?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「たまに、男と男の間のこともありますが」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Well, occasionally between two men.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Well, occasionally between two men.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「多くの場合は、そうだと思います」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝But mostly so, I'd say.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝But mostly so, I'd say.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「百首のうちの、半数近くが恋を歌っているそうです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝They say more than half of the works in the anthology are devoted to love.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝They say more than half of the works in the anthology are devoted to love.❞

MESSAGE.JP: それから一度、川の流れに目を向ける。
MESSAGE.EN: She turned to look at the river again.
MESSAGE.Translation: She turned to look at the river again.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「瀬をはやみ　岩にせかるる滝川の　われても末に逢わんとぞ思う」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝The rock divides the stream in two, and both with might and main go tumbling down the waterfall; but well I know the twain will soon unite again.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝The rock divides the stream in two, and both with might and main go tumbling down the waterfall; but well I know the twain will soon unite again.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「これは崇徳院が詠んだ有名な歌です」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝This is a famous piece by Sutokuin.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝This is a famous piece by Sutokuin.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「川の流れが速くなり、岩にさしかかったところで二叉に別れてしまっても、またいつかは合流してひとつになる」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Even if the river current speeds up and splits into two, the two will eventually meet again.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Even if the river current speeds up and splits into two, the two will eventually meet again.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「離ればなれになってしまった恋人とも、そんな風にして再び逢いたいものだ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝In other words, he's wishing he could once again meet his lover, who is very far apart from him, like how the flowing river reunites.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝In other words, he's wishing he could once again meet his lover, who is very far apart from him, like how the flowing river reunites.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「そんな内容です」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝That's what the poem is actually about.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝That's what the poem is actually about.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「この歌が、実際に流れる川を目の前にして詠まれたかどうかは分かりませんが、もしそうだとしたら、崇徳院はどういう気持ちで川を眺めたのでしょうか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝It is not known if he made the poem by a particular river. But if he did, I'm very curious about how he felt as he was watching the river.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝It is not known if he made the poem by a particular river. But if he did, I'm very curious about how he felt as he was watching the river.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「保元の乱の失敗で、実の弟の後白河天皇によって流刑に処された崇徳院は、流されたその地で亡くなりました」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝He was banished from the country by his own brother, the Go-Shirakawa emperor, because of the failure of the Hogen Rebellion. And he died in the penal colony.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝He was banished from the country by his own brother, the Go-Shirakawa emperor, because of the failure of the Hogen Rebellion. And he died in the penal colony.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「逢いたい人と、逢えないままに…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝In the end he couldn't meet again the one who he had longed to see...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝In the end he couldn't meet again the one who he had longed to see...❞

MESSAGE.JP: そう言って、西園さんは深いため息をついた。
MESSAGE.EN: Saying so, she let out a deep sigh.
MESSAGE.Translation: Saying so, she let out a deep sigh.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「…直枝さんは、誰か好きな人はいますか？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝...Naoe-san, is there any particular girl you like right now?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝...Naoe-san, is there any particular girl you like right now?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「ぼ、僕っ？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝M-me!?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝M-me!?❞

MESSAGE.JP: …あまり考えたこともなかった。
MESSAGE.EN: ...I had barely given that kind of thing any thought.
MESSAGE.Translation: ...I had barely given that kind of thing any thought.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「鈴さんとは、小さい頃からずっと一緒なのですよね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝You have been with Rin-san since you were both little, have you not?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝You have been with Rin-san since you were both little, have you not?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「鈴さんは、直枝さんの恋人ではないのですか？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Isn't she your girlfriend?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Isn't she your girlfriend?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「鈴、か。鈴は…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Rin, well she's...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Rin, well she's...❞

MESSAGE.JP: 確かに、子供の頃から当たり前のように傍にいる。
MESSAGE.EN: Like she said, Rin and I had always been together.
MESSAGE.Translation: Like she said, Rin and I had always been together.

MESSAGE.JP: 一緒にいれば楽しい。
MESSAGE.EN: I've had a lot of fun spending time with her.
MESSAGE.Translation: I've had a lot of fun spending time with her.

MESSAGE.JP: いや、楽しいとかそういう感情さえ通り越している気がする。
MESSAGE.EN: No, there was something more than just fun.
MESSAGE.Translation: No, there was something more than just fun.

MESSAGE.JP: でも…じゃあ、その気持ちは恋、なんだろうか。
MESSAGE.EN: But... would I define it as love?
MESSAGE.Translation: But... would I define it as love?

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「わからないよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝I don't know.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝I don't know.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 僕は正直に答えた。
MESSAGE.EN: I answered honestly.
MESSAGE.Translation: I answered honestly.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「あまりにも近すぎて、そういう感じじゃないのかもしれない」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝I guess I'm too close to her to see my feelings clearly.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝I guess I'm too close to her to see my feelings clearly.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「そう、ですか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝I see.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝I see.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「鈴さんが羨ましいですね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝I wish I were her.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝I wish I were her.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「…どうして？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝...How come?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝...How come?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「恭介さんや、井ノ原さん、宮沢さん、そして直枝さん」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Kyousuke-san, Inohara-san, Miyazawa-san, and Naoe-san.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Kyousuke-san, Inohara-san, Miyazawa-san, and Naoe-san.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「いつまでも変わらない気持ちのままで、傍にいる人たちがいる」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝She's always been surrounded by friends who care for her.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝She's always been surrounded by friends who care for her.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「きっと、そこがみなさんの居場所なんでしょうね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝That must be where you and your friends belong.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝That must be where you and your friends belong.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「…いや、そんな大層なものじゃないよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝...No, it's not as great as you're making it out to be.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝...No, it's not as great as you're making it out to be.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 改めて言われると、恥ずかしくなってしまう。
MESSAGE.EN: Her saying so made me bashful.
MESSAGE.Translation: Her saying so made me bashful.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「…わたしにも子供の頃、大切な子がいました」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝I, too, used to have a person important to me when I was little.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝I, too, used to have a person important to me when I was little.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「いました？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Used to?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Used to?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「そう、です。過去形のお話です」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Yes, it was a long time ago.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Yes, it was a long time ago.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「でも…崇徳院の歌ではありませんが、いつかは再会する日が来るかも知れません」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Nevertheless... It's not like I want to refer to the Sutokuin poem, but I might be able see her again some day.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Nevertheless... It's not like I want to refer to the Sutokuin poem, but I might be able see her again some day.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「いえ…おそらく、その日はそれほど遠くないでしょう」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝No... In fact it's probably going to happen before too long.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝No... In fact it's probably going to happen before too long.❞

MESSAGE.JP: そう言うと、小さく息を吐いた。
MESSAGE.EN: She let out a sigh.
MESSAGE.Translation: She let out a sigh.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「西園さん…よかったね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝I see... that's great.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝I see... that's great.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 事情はわからないけど、会いたい人と会える、それはきっと喜ばしいことに違いない。
MESSAGE.EN: Although I did not know anything about the relationship between them, I was certain it would be a great thing to see somebody whom you had longed to see.
MESSAGE.Translation: Although I did not know anything about the relationship between them, I was certain it would be a great thing to see somebody whom you had longed to see.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「よかったら、僕にも紹介してよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝If you don't mind, let me meet her too.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝If you don't mind, let me meet her too.❞

MESSAGE.JP: それがどんな人か、僕にも興味があった。
MESSAGE.EN: I was interested in that person.
MESSAGE.Translation: I was interested in that person.

MESSAGE.JP: そして…多分、少しは妬ましい気持ちさえも。
MESSAGE.EN: I might... have even been jealous of that person.
MESSAGE.Translation: I might... have even been jealous of that person.

MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝.......I will.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝.......I will.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「あの子は…、そして、わたしも…もう昔とは同じ気持ちを抱いていない」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝She... and even I... no longer hold the feeling... we used to.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝She... and even I... no longer hold the feeling... we used to.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 笑みを浮かべたまま、西園さんは言う。
MESSAGE.EN: She was still smiling as she spoke.
MESSAGE.Translation: She was still smiling as she spoke.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「わたしは…大きくなってしまいました」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝I have... grown up.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝I have... grown up.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「もう、子供の頃には戻れない」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝I can't go back to my childhood.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝I can't go back to my childhood.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「それでも、わたしはあの子に会いたいのです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝But I still want to see her.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝But I still want to see her.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 僕たちの間を、冷たい風が吹き抜ける。
MESSAGE.EN: A gust of cold wind blew through between us.
MESSAGE.Translation: A gust of cold wind blew through between us.

MESSAGE.JP: 今、西園さんは何を見ているのだろう。
MESSAGE.EN: I wondered what it was she was seeing right then.
MESSAGE.Translation: I wondered what it was she was seeing right then.

MESSAGE.JP: 僕の目に入るのは、見慣れた河原の風景だ。
MESSAGE.EN: What I saw was the river bank I was very familiar with.
MESSAGE.Translation: What I saw was the river bank I was very familiar with.

MESSAGE.JP: それ以上でも、以下でもない。
MESSAGE.EN: It was no more and no less than that.
MESSAGE.Translation: It was no more and no less than that.

MESSAGE.JP: でも――。
MESSAGE.EN: But.
MESSAGE.Translation: But.

MESSAGE.JP: 西園さんの瞳には何が映っているのだろうか。
MESSAGE.EN: What was she seeing through those eyes?
MESSAGE.Translation: What was she seeing through those eyes?

MESSAGE.JP: 僕と同じ場所にいながら、僕とは違うものを見ている。
MESSAGE.EN: Even though we were standing here at the same place, I felt certain she was seeing something more than I was.
MESSAGE.Translation: Even though we were standing here at the same place, I felt certain she was seeing something more than I was.

MESSAGE.JP: 影のかかった西園さんの横顔を見る。
MESSAGE.EN: I glanced at her shaded profile.
MESSAGE.Translation: I glanced at her shaded profile.

MESSAGE.JP: 西園さんの話は脈略がなく、半分も理解できない。
MESSAGE.EN: I could never understand even half of what she was talking about, due to her habit of running off on tangents.
MESSAGE.Translation: I could never understand even half of what she was talking about, due to her habit of running off on tangents.

MESSAGE.JP: それを知りたい、と思う気持ちを僕はどう呼べばいいのだろう。
MESSAGE.EN: I want to know what she was talking about. I wonder what that feeling is called?
MESSAGE.Translation: I want to know what she was talking about. I wonder what that feeling is called?

MESSAGE.JP: 言葉にすれば、それはあっという間に崩れてしまいそうなあやふやな気持ちだった。
MESSAGE.EN: The feeling was so vague and fragile that the mere effort of expressing it with words might have made it collapse.
MESSAGE.Translation: The feeling was so vague and fragile that the mere effort of expressing it with words might have made it collapse.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「直枝さん、あれを見てください」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Naoe-san, look at that.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Naoe-san, look at that.❞

MESSAGE.JP: その横顔がふいにこちらを向いて、僕は驚く。
MESSAGE.EN: I was taken by surprise when she suddenly turned to face me.
MESSAGE.Translation: I was taken by surprise when she suddenly turned to face me.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「どうかしましたか？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝What is wrong?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝What is wrong?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「う、ううん。なにも…それよりも、どうしたの？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝N-no, never mind. What did you find?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝N-no, never mind. What did you find?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「………もう、見えなくなってしまいました」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝.........It's already gone.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝.........It's already gone.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「子供たちが、紙飛行機を飛ばしていたんです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝A boy over there threw a paper airplane.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝A boy over there threw a paper airplane.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 河原で遊んでいるのは、近所の小学生だろうか。
MESSAGE.EN: There were several children playing by the riverside, who looked to be grade schoolers.
MESSAGE.Translation: There were several children playing by the riverside, who looked to be grade schoolers.

MESSAGE.JP: 見ると、彼らの興味はすでに別のことに移ったのか、鬼ごっこを始めるところだった。
MESSAGE.EN: Apparently, they had already forgotten about the airplane and were now starting to play tag.
MESSAGE.Translation: Apparently, they had already forgotten about the airplane and were now starting to play tag.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「それは綺麗に飛んでいったんですよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝The plane was flying away so beautifully.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝The plane was flying away so beautifully.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「この川風にうまく乗れば、どこまでも遠くまで飛んでいくかも知れませんね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝If it could manage to ride on this river wind, it might be able to go any distance.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝If it could manage to ride on this river wind, it might be able to go any distance.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「そうだね。僕も見たかったな」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Yeah. I'd like to have seen that.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Yeah. I'd like to have seen that.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 僕は後ろを振り返る。
MESSAGE.EN: I looked over my shoulder.
MESSAGE.Translation: I looked over my shoulder.

MESSAGE.JP: 西園さんが見たという紙飛行機は、もう見えない。
MESSAGE.EN: The paper airplane, which she had mentioned, could no longer be seen.
MESSAGE.Translation: The paper airplane, which she had mentioned, could no longer be seen.

MESSAGE.JP: 落ちてしまったのだろうか。
MESSAGE.EN: Perhaps it had fallen to the ground.
MESSAGE.Translation: Perhaps it had fallen to the ground.

MESSAGE.JP: いや、西園さんの言うように、遠くまで飛んでいったと僕は信じたい。
MESSAGE.EN: No, I wished to believe that it still kept drifting ahead there, heading afar.
MESSAGE.Translation: No, I wished to believe that it still kept drifting ahead there, heading afar.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「紙でできた飛行機なんて…自然の摂理に従えば、いつかは落ちるに決まっています」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝There's no way that... a paper plane can overcome natural laws and keep on flying.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝There's no way that... a paper plane can overcome natural laws and keep on flying.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「それでも…その飛行機に乗ってどこかに飛んで行けたら、それは素敵なことかも知れません」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝But still... It'd be wonderful if we could just get on the plane and be whisked away.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝But still... It'd be wonderful if we could just get on the plane and be whisked away.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「…直枝さんだったら、どこに行きたいですか？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝...Naoe-san, where would you like to go?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝...Naoe-san, where would you like to go?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「えっ…行きたいところ？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Eh... Me?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Eh... Me?❞

MESSAGE.JP: うーん、と考える。
MESSAGE.EN: I focused my mind on the question.
MESSAGE.Translation: I focused my mind on the question.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「ハワイ、とか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Hawaii, maybe.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Hawaii, maybe.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 常夏の島、ハワイ。
MESSAGE.EN: Hawaii, an island of endless summer.
MESSAGE.Translation: Hawaii, an island of endless summer.

MESSAGE.JP: 椰子の木、アロハシャツ、フラダンス。
MESSAGE.EN: Palm trees, aloha shirts, hula...
MESSAGE.Translation: Palm trees, aloha shirts, hula...

MESSAGE.JP: そして、青い空に青い海。
MESSAGE.EN: An azure sky and a turquoise ocean.
MESSAGE.Translation: An azure sky and a turquoise ocean.

MESSAGE.JP: …咄嗟に思い浮かぶのが、そんな場所って。
MESSAGE.EN: ...Those were the first thoughts to surface in my mind upon mention of the place.
MESSAGE.Translation: ...Those were the first thoughts to surface in my mind upon mention of the place.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「ぷっ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Puh.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Puh.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「わ、笑わなくてもいいじゃないか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Y-you don't have to laugh.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Y-you don't have to laugh.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「すみません。なんだか、子供みたいで可笑しくて…つい」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Sorry. You somehow sounded so much like a child... Too funny, couldn't resist.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Sorry. You somehow sounded so much like a child... Too funny, couldn't resist.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「…どうせ僕は発想力が貧困ですよだ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝...I'm well aware I have little imagination.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝...I'm well aware I have little imagination.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 地面にのの字を書いてみた。
MESSAGE.EN: I was tracing letters on the ground with my finger.
MESSAGE.Translation: I was tracing letters on the ground with my finger.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「直枝さん、そんなに拗ねないでください」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Naoe-san, please don't sulk like that.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Naoe-san, please don't sulk like that.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「あはは…いつもはからかわれることが多いから、たまには新鮮だね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Ahaha... I was just joking a little because you're always teasing me.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Ahaha... I was just joking a little because you're always teasing me.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「…ひどいです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝...That's terrible.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝...That's terrible.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「そんな意地悪をすると、直枝さんのこと嫌いになりますよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝I will dislike you if you keep being mean to me like that.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝I will dislike you if you keep being mean to me like that.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「えっ、それは困るよ。僕は西園さんのことが…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Eh!? That'd be a big problem, because I li...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Eh!? That'd be a big problem, because I li...❞

MESSAGE.JP: 言いかけて、慌てて僕は口を噤む。
MESSAGE.EN: I abruptly broke off in the middle.
MESSAGE.Translation: I abruptly broke off in the middle.

MESSAGE.JP: 今、僕は何を言おうとしたのだろう。
MESSAGE.EN: W-What did I just try to say?
MESSAGE.Translation: W-What did I just try to say?

MESSAGE.JP: 自然に口をつきかけた言葉は、いったい何だったんだろう。
MESSAGE.EN: What could have been the words which were about to escape my lips?
MESSAGE.Translation: What could have been the words which were about to escape my lips?

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「じゃ、じゃあ、西園さんはどうなのさ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝W-what about you, Nishizono-san? Where would you go?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝W-what about you, Nishizono-san? Where would you go?❞

MESSAGE.JP: そのことを深く考えないようにして、僕は話題を蒸し返す。
MESSAGE.EN: Struggling to put it out of my mind, I returned to the previous topic.
MESSAGE.Translation: Struggling to put it out of my mind, I returned to the previous topic.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「わたし…ですか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Where would I... go?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Where would I... go?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「わたしも、ハワイでしょうか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝I would say... Hawaii too.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝I would say... Hawaii too.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「常夏の楽園、青い海に焼けるような白い砂浜」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝A paradise of endless summer, a blue sea and scorching, white sand.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝A paradise of endless summer, a blue sea and scorching, white sand.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「…水着になるのは、ちょっと恥ずかしいですが」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝...Wearing a swimming suit is a little bit embarrassing, though.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝...Wearing a swimming suit is a little bit embarrassing, though.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 僕の目をじっと見る。
MESSAGE.EN: She stared into my eyes.
MESSAGE.Translation: She stared into my eyes.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「もう、それはいいから…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Forget Hawaii already...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Forget Hawaii already...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「そう、ですか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝All... right.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝All... right.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「冗談はさておいても、やはり海でしょうか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Joking aside, it would have to be the sea after all.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Joking aside, it would have to be the sea after all.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「白い紙飛行機に乗って、ずっと、ずーっと飛んでいきたいです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝I wish to get on a white paper plane and fly as far as it would go.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝I wish to get on a white paper plane and fly as far as it would go.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「青い空と、青い海。無限に続く青い世界を、いつまでも進んでいきたい」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝A blue sky and a blue sea. I wish to travel in a world of endless blue forever.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝A blue sky and a blue sea. I wish to travel in a world of endless blue forever.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「そんな風景が見てみたいです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝I'd like to see that.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝I'd like to see that.❞

MESSAGE.JP: そう言って微笑む顔に、僕はなぜか不安を覚える。
MESSAGE.EN: Though she smiled, it only made me somehow anxious.
MESSAGE.Translation: Though she smiled, it only made me somehow anxious.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「でも、そんな場所はこの地球上にはないよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝But there's no such place here on Earth.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝But there's no such place here on Earth.❞

MESSAGE.JP: だからだろうか、そうやって否定する僕の口調はしらずしらずのうちに、強いものになっていた。
MESSAGE.EN: It could be due to the uneasy feeling; I unconsciously voiced a strong denial of her wish.
MESSAGE.Translation: It could be due to the uneasy feeling; I unconsciously voiced a strong denial of her wish.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「海をずっと行けば、いつかは陸が見えてくる」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝You'll definitely reach land beyond the sea.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝You'll definitely reach land beyond the sea.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「地球は丸いんだから…どこに行ったとしても、きっとここに帰ってくる」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝The Earth is round... so wherever you go, you'll eventually end up where you started.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝The Earth is round... so wherever you go, you'll eventually end up where you started.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「直枝さんの言うとおりです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝You are exactly correct.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝You are exactly correct.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「だから、これは…他愛もない夢です」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Therefore... that is just a silly little dream.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Therefore... that is just a silly little dream.❞

MESSAGE.JP: そして、やはり微笑むのだった。
MESSAGE.EN: Then she showed me her usual smile.
MESSAGE.Translation: Then she showed me her usual smile.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「直枝さん、そろそろ帰りましょうか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Naoe-san, why don't we go back?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Naoe-san, why don't we go back?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「もう、陽も落ちます」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝It's almost sunset.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝It's almost sunset.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「歌は…いいの？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝But we haven't made any poems yet. Are you okay with that?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝But we haven't made any poems yet. Are you okay with that?❞

MESSAGE.JP: そもそも、短歌を作るために外に出たのに。
MESSAGE.EN: In the first place, the purpose of this little trip was to create tankas.
MESSAGE.Translation: In the first place, the purpose of this little trip was to create tankas.

MESSAGE.JP: 結局、なにもしなかった。
MESSAGE.EN: It turned out, however, that we hadn't gotten anything done.
MESSAGE.Translation: It turned out, however, that we hadn't gotten anything done.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「はい」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Yes.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Yes.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「もう、大丈夫で…
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝I'm oka...
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝I'm oka...

MESSAGE.JP: くちゅん」
MESSAGE.EN: Choo!❞
MESSAGE.Translation: Choo!❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「くちゅん？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Choo?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Choo?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「い、いえ。もう、大丈夫で…
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝I, I mean, I'm oka...
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝I, I mean, I'm oka...

MESSAGE.JP: っくちゅん」
MESSAGE.EN: CHOO!❞
MESSAGE.Translation: CHOO!❞

MESSAGE.JP: さっきよりも大きな音。
MESSAGE.EN: Another sneeze, louder than the previous one.
MESSAGE.Translation: Another sneeze, louder than the previous one.

MESSAGE.JP: 慌てて口を押さえた西園さんの顔が真っ赤になる。
MESSAGE.EN: She put her hands over her mouth as her face flushed beet red.
MESSAGE.Translation: She put her hands over her mouth as her face flushed beet red.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「す、すみません」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝P, pardon me.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝P, pardon me.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「…少しばかり風に当たりすぎたようです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝...I think I spent a little too long sitting in the cold.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝...I think I spent a little too long sitting in the cold.❞

MESSAGE.JP: そう言って、自分の体を両手で抱える。
MESSAGE.EN: She embraced herself as she said it.
MESSAGE.Translation: She embraced herself as she said it.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「風邪を引いたら、大変だ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝It'll be bad if you catch a cold.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝It'll be bad if you catch a cold.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「早く帰らなくっちゃ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝We'd better go home now.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝We'd better go home now.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「ぐっどもーにんぐです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝Guddo morningu.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝Guddo morningu.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 教室に入ってきたクドは自分の席に鞄も置かずに、僕のところにやってきた。
MESSAGE.EN: Entering in the classroom, Kud came straight to my desk without even putting down her bag at her desk.
MESSAGE.Translation: Entering in the classroom, Kud came straight to my desk without even putting down her bag at her desk.

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「わふっ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝Wafu.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝Wafu.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 一直線に向かおうとして、机に何度かつまずいたけど。
MESSAGE.EN: She stumbled on desks a few times on her way.
MESSAGE.Translation: She stumbled on desks a few times on her way.

MESSAGE.JP: その顔はいつになく、真剣だった。
MESSAGE.EN: But she had an uncharacteristically serious look on her face.
MESSAGE.Translation: But she had an uncharacteristically serious look on her face.

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「おはようございます」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝Good morning.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝Good morning.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「うん、おはよう」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Yeah, morning.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Yeah, morning.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「西園さんから伝言があります」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝I have a message from Nishizono-san.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝I have a message from Nishizono-san.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「今日は休みます、だそうです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝She's taking a day off today.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝She's taking a day off today.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「やっぱり、風邪ひいたのかな？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Has she got a cold?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Has she got a cold?❞

MESSAGE.JP: …昨日の別れ際は少し辛そうだった。
MESSAGE.EN: ...She seemed to be feeling sickly when we separated yesterday.
MESSAGE.Translation: ...She seemed to be feeling sickly when we separated yesterday.

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「分からないです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝I'm not sure.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝I'm not sure.❞

MESSAGE.JP: クドは首を横に振る。
MESSAGE.EN: She shook her head.
MESSAGE.Translation: She shook her head.

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「ただ気分が悪いから、とだけです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝She just said she wasn't feeling good.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝She just said she wasn't feeling good.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「そう…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Okay...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Okay...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「あの…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝Um...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝Um...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「よろしければ、帰りにお見舞いに来てください」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝If it's fine with you, would you please visit her after school?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝If it's fine with you, would you please visit her after school?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「僕が？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Me?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Me?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「はい。きっと西園さん喜ぶと思いますよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝Yes. I bet she'll be happy to see you.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝Yes. I bet she'll be happy to see you.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「この幸せ者め、ですよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝What a lucky guy you are!❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝What a lucky guy you are!❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「そ、そうかなあ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝I, I don't think so.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝I, I don't think so.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 確かにクドの提案は悪くない。
MESSAGE.EN: Her idea sounded nice, however.
MESSAGE.Translation: Her idea sounded nice, however.

MESSAGE.JP: 放課後、クドと一緒に帰ることにしよう。
MESSAGE.EN: I decided to go along to the girls' dorm with her after school.
MESSAGE.Translation: I decided to go along to the girls' dorm with her after school.

MESSAGE.JP: 例えば真人や葉留佳さんが一日休んだとしたら、きっとみんなが口を揃えて、『今日は静かだ』『いや、天変地異の前触れだ』と言うことだろうけど。
MESSAGE.EN: If Masato or Haruka-san took a day off of school, most people in the class would be all ❛It's so peaceful today❜ or ❛No, it must be an omen of some kind of catastrophe.❜
MESSAGE.Translation: If Masato or Haruka-san took a day off of school, most people in the class would be all ❛It's so peaceful today❜ or ❛No, it must be an omen of some kind of catastrophe.❜

MESSAGE.JP: でも、おとなしい西園さんが休んだところでクラスの騒々しさに変化はもたらされない。
MESSAGE.EN: But there was no change in the usual chatter when the ever-quiet Nishizono-san was missing.
MESSAGE.Translation: But there was no change in the usual chatter when the ever-quiet Nishizono-san was missing.

MESSAGE.JP: 何も変わらないはずだった。
MESSAGE.EN: There was supposed to be no change.
MESSAGE.Translation: There was supposed to be no change.

MESSAGE.JP: だけど。
MESSAGE.EN: However.
MESSAGE.Translation: However.

MESSAGE.JP: 僕の心はふたつの意味でざわめく。
MESSAGE.EN: There were two feelings stirring uneasily in my chest.
MESSAGE.Translation: There were two feelings stirring uneasily in my chest.

MESSAGE.JP: ひとつは、こうして認めることはなにか恥ずかしいことだけれど。
MESSAGE.EN: It was somewhat embarrassing to admit it, but...
MESSAGE.Translation: It was somewhat embarrassing to admit it, but...

MESSAGE.JP: 西園さんの姿が見えないことを、僕がとても寂しいと思っていることだ。
MESSAGE.EN: One was a loneliness stemming from her not being here.
MESSAGE.Translation: One was a loneliness stemming from her not being here.

MESSAGE.JP: 授業中、ちらちらと廊下側の空席に目がいってしまう。
MESSAGE.EN: I could not resist the urge to peek at her empty desk during class.
MESSAGE.Translation: I could not resist the urge to peek at her empty desk during class.

MESSAGE.JP: いつもはある小さな後ろ姿がないことを知っているはずなのに、それでも僕は目を向ける。
MESSAGE.EN: Despite the fact that nobody was sitting there, my eyes still kept straying to the desk.
MESSAGE.Translation: Despite the fact that nobody was sitting there, my eyes still kept straying to the desk.

MESSAGE.JP: どうしてだろう。
MESSAGE.EN: Why?
MESSAGE.Translation: Why?

MESSAGE.JP: その答えを出すことを、僕はためらう。
MESSAGE.EN: I hesitated to put the answer into words.
MESSAGE.Translation: I hesitated to put the answer into words.

MESSAGE.JP: もうひとつは…もっと漠然とした、不安だ。
MESSAGE.EN: And the other was... a more looming disquiet.
MESSAGE.Translation: And the other was... a more looming disquiet.

MESSAGE.JP: 今日に限ったことじゃなくて、この数日、何かが違うと感じていた。
MESSAGE.EN: It wasn't just today. Something had been bugging me for the past several days.
MESSAGE.Translation: It wasn't just today. Something had been bugging me for the past several days.

MESSAGE.JP: 今まで、西園さんに関わってこなかった大半のクラスメイトたち。
MESSAGE.EN: Most of the classmates, who hadn't been involved with Nishizono-san earlier...
MESSAGE.Translation: Most of the classmates, who hadn't been involved with Nishizono-san earlier...

MESSAGE.JP: 彼らは、まるで――。
MESSAGE.EN: Now they...
MESSAGE.Translation: Now they...

MESSAGE.JP: 西園さんが本当に影であるかのように、気に止める様子がなかった。
MESSAGE.EN: They did not pay any attention to her at all, as if she had been an actual shadow.
MESSAGE.Translation: They did not pay any attention to her at all, as if she had been an actual shadow.

MESSAGE.JP: 以前からもそうだった、と言われると少し違う。
MESSAGE.EN: Some might say it had always been like that, but I didn't think that was right.
MESSAGE.Translation: Some might say it had always been like that, but I didn't think that was right.

MESSAGE.JP: 確かに、西園さんに友人は少ない。
MESSAGE.EN: Admittedly, she did not have a lot of friends.
MESSAGE.Translation: Admittedly, she did not have a lot of friends.

MESSAGE.JP: 休み時間にもひとりで本を読んでいることがほとんどだった。
MESSAGE.EN: She usually read books alone even during recess.
MESSAGE.Translation: She usually read books alone even during recess.

MESSAGE.JP: そして。
MESSAGE.EN: In addition to that.
MESSAGE.Translation: In addition to that.

MESSAGE.JP: 常に日傘を持っている西園さんは、変わり者だった。
MESSAGE.EN: She was considered something of a weirdo due to the fact that she carried her parasol anywhere and anytime.
MESSAGE.Translation: She was considered something of a weirdo due to the fact that she carried her parasol anywhere and anytime.

MESSAGE.JP: 変わっている、だから興味を引いた。
MESSAGE.EN: But that sort of strangeness was why I had taken an interest in her.
MESSAGE.Translation: But that sort of strangeness was why I had taken an interest in her.

MESSAGE.JP: 良い悪いは別にして、西園さんは一目置かれていたのだ。
MESSAGE.EN: No matter whether it was in a good or bad way, most of the class thought of her as peculiar.
MESSAGE.Translation: No matter whether it was in a good or bad way, most of the class thought of her as peculiar.

MESSAGE.JP: その雰囲気が、少し違っているように思えた。
MESSAGE.EN: However, that common awareness among them appeared to be a little bit different from usual now.
MESSAGE.Translation: However, that common awareness among them appeared to be a little bit different from usual now.

MESSAGE.JP: 今日、西園さんは休んでいる。
MESSAGE.EN: Today she was not in the classroom.
MESSAGE.Translation: Today she was not in the classroom.

MESSAGE.JP: そのことを気に止めている生徒はクドなど数人を除いて、いない。
MESSAGE.EN: No one in the class except for Kud and and the other Little Busters members appeared to even have noticed.
MESSAGE.Translation: No one in the class except for Kud and and the other Little Busters members appeared to even have noticed.

MESSAGE.JP: みな、いつも通りに騒がしい日常に興じている。
MESSAGE.EN: Everyone was just going about their day as normal.
MESSAGE.Translation: Everyone was just going about their day as normal.

MESSAGE.JP: 西園さんの不在さえも、気づいていないんじゃないかと思うくらいに。
MESSAGE.EN: Too busy to even realize that they were lacking a certain classmate.
MESSAGE.Translation: Too busy to even realize that they were lacking a certain classmate.

MESSAGE.JP: その『不在』がきっかけに、何かが動き出すんじゃないだろうか。
MESSAGE.EN: That ❛lack❜ could be a trigger that would give rise to something.
MESSAGE.Translation: That ❛lack❜ could be a trigger that would give rise to something.

MESSAGE.JP: そんな漠然とした不安が、僕には付きまとう。
MESSAGE.EN: I couldn't rid myself of this uneasy feeling.
MESSAGE.Translation: I couldn't rid myself of this uneasy feeling.

MESSAGE.JP: 僕らは、他のクラスメイトが知らない西園さんの一面を知っている。
MESSAGE.EN: We Little Busters did know aspects of her which the other people did not.
MESSAGE.Translation: We Little Busters did know aspects of her which the other people did not.

MESSAGE.JP: リトルバスターズで見せてくれた顔を、知っている。
MESSAGE.EN: We had seen the faces she only had showed to us.
MESSAGE.Translation: We had seen the faces she only had showed to us.

MESSAGE.JP: でも、本当にそうなんだろうか。
MESSAGE.EN: But was that really it?
MESSAGE.Translation: But was that really it?

MESSAGE.JP: 三時間目が終わる。
MESSAGE.EN: The third period was over.
MESSAGE.Translation: The third period was over.

MESSAGE.JP: `男子@「おはよーす」
MESSAGE.EN: `Male Student@❝Morning.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Male Student@❝Morning.❞

MESSAGE.JP: ひとりの生徒がこの時間になって教室に入ってきた。
MESSAGE.EN: At that very moment, a student entered the classroom.
MESSAGE.Translation: At that very moment, a student entered the classroom.

MESSAGE.JP: 彼は遅刻の常連だ。寝坊などではなく、午前中はどこかで遊んでいるとの話だ。
MESSAGE.EN: He usually came in late; I heard it was because he used to loiter away the mornings somewhere.
MESSAGE.Translation: He usually came in late; I heard it was because he used to loiter away the mornings somewhere.

MESSAGE.JP: 挨拶に続けて彼は、こう言った。
MESSAGE.EN: After the greeting, he went on.
MESSAGE.Translation: After the greeting, he went on.

MESSAGE.JP: `男子@「やっぱ、西園いねえんだな」
MESSAGE.EN: `Male Student@❝So Nishizono really isn't here.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Male Student@❝So Nishizono really isn't here.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 周りの生徒は『ああ、そういえば休みだね』くらいの反応だったけど。
MESSAGE.EN: His remark about Nishizono's absence stood in such stark contrast to the indifference of the rest of the class...
MESSAGE.Translation: His remark about Nishizono's absence stood in such stark contrast to the indifference of the rest of the class...

MESSAGE.JP: その言葉を聞いた僕はいても立ってもいられなかった。
MESSAGE.EN: ...that it prompted me to ask.
MESSAGE.Translation: ...that it prompted me to ask.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「西園さんがどうかしたの？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝What about her?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝What about her?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `男子@「いや、さっき西園を見たから」
MESSAGE.EN: `Male Student@❝Well, I just saw her a moment back.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Male Student@❝Well, I just saw her a moment back.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `男子@「すげえ珍しいこともあるもんだって思っただけさ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Male Student@❝And I just thought that was pretty unusual.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Male Student@❝And I just thought that was pretty unusual.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「外で？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝You saw her outside?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝You saw her outside?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `男子@「ああ。あいつがサボりなんて、ありえねえだろ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Male Student@❝Yeah. Hard to believe she would cut class, huh?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Male Student@❝Yeah. Hard to believe she would cut class, huh?❞

MESSAGE.JP: それから、さも面白そうに笑う。
MESSAGE.EN: He then laughed as though he found it hilarious.
MESSAGE.Translation: He then laughed as though he found it hilarious.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「それは間違いなく西園さんだったの？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Are you certain it was her?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Are you certain it was her?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `男子@「…いや、そう言われると自信はねえけどよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Male Student@❝I can't be entirely sure.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Male Student@❝I can't be entirely sure.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `男子@「そもそも、あいつってどんな顔してたっけな」
MESSAGE.EN: `Male Student@❝I didn't get a good look at her face, as a matter of fact.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Male Student@❝I didn't get a good look at her face, as a matter of fact.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `男子@「さっき見た時は確かに西園だと思ったんだけど、見間違いかも知れねえ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Male Student@❝My first impression was that it was her for sure, but I could be wrong.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Male Student@❝My first impression was that it was her for sure, but I could be wrong.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `男子@「あー、やっぱ違うわ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Male Student@❝Ahh, no, it wasn't her.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Male Student@❝Ahh, no, it wasn't her.❞

MESSAGE.JP: いきなり納得したような大きな声を出す。
MESSAGE.EN: He said louder and with conviction.
MESSAGE.Translation: He said louder and with conviction.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「どういうこと？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝How can you be sure?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝How can you be sure?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `男子@「だって、日傘をしてなかったもんな」
MESSAGE.EN: `Male Student@❝She wasn't with her parasol.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Male Student@❝She wasn't with her parasol.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `男子@「『カゲナシ』が、そんなわけねえからな」
MESSAGE.EN: `Male Student@❝❛No shadow❜ has it with her all the time, doesn't she?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Male Student@❝❛No shadow❜ has it with her all the time, doesn't she?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「そう…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Oh...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Oh...❞

MESSAGE.JP: 西園さんは風邪で休んでいる。
MESSAGE.EN: Nishizono-san was absent with a cold.
MESSAGE.Translation: Nishizono-san was absent with a cold.

MESSAGE.JP: クドがそう言う以上、間違いはないだろう。
MESSAGE.EN: I don't think Kud would've lied.
MESSAGE.Translation: I don't think Kud would've lied.

MESSAGE.JP: もし体調が良くなったところで、日中に街に出かけるとも思えない。
MESSAGE.EN: Even if she was feeling better, it was not likely that she'd go out to the town in broad daylight.
MESSAGE.Translation: Even if she was feeling better, it was not likely that she'd go out to the town in broad daylight.

MESSAGE.JP: 彼が言うとおり、見間違いだ、の一言で片付けるのが一番のはずだ。
MESSAGE.EN: As he had said, it would be best to conclude that he must have been mistaken.
MESSAGE.Translation: As he had said, it would be best to conclude that he must have been mistaken.

MESSAGE.JP: なのに、先ほどから感じている不安は大きくなるばかりだ。
MESSAGE.EN: Yet the apprehension which had been haunting me continued to grow.
MESSAGE.Translation: Yet the apprehension which had been haunting me continued to grow.

MESSAGE.JP: 先日、僕も見た。
MESSAGE.EN: The other day.
MESSAGE.Translation: The other day.

MESSAGE.JP: 西園さんと良く似た女の子が歩いているのを。
MESSAGE.EN: I had also seen a girl that very strongly resembled Nishizono-san.
MESSAGE.Translation: I had also seen a girl that very strongly resembled Nishizono-san.

MESSAGE.JP: その子も傘を差していなかった。
MESSAGE.EN: And that girl had not had a parasol either.
MESSAGE.Translation: And that girl had not had a parasol either.

MESSAGE.JP: 僕だけじゃなく、他にも見た人がいる。
MESSAGE.EN: Now there was somebody else here who had run across that girl.
MESSAGE.Translation: Now there was somebody else here who had run across that girl.

MESSAGE.JP: 見間違い、で果たして済むんだろうか。
MESSAGE.EN: Was she really not Nishizono-san?
MESSAGE.Translation: Was she really not Nishizono-san?

MESSAGE.JP: 落ち着かないままに、一日が終わる。
MESSAGE.EN: Without me being able to dispel my uneasiness, the day's lessons drew to an end.
MESSAGE.Translation: Without me being able to dispel my uneasiness, the day's lessons drew to an end.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「クド、じゃあ行こうか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Kud, you ready to go?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Kud, you ready to go?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「はい？　どこにですか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝What? Go where?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝What? Go where?❞

MESSAGE.JP: 無邪気な笑顔でクドが聞き返す。
MESSAGE.EN: She asked me back with a guileless smile.
MESSAGE.Translation: She asked me back with a guileless smile.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「クドの部屋だよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝To your room.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝To your room.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「わ、わふっ！」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝Wa, wafu!❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝Wa, wafu!❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「い、いきなりですか？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝I-isn't that too fast?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝I-isn't that too fast?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「は、はずかしいです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝I-I'm embarrassed.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝I-I'm embarrassed.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「ややや、やっぱり最初は手を繋ぐところからですね…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝W-w-w-we really should start by holding hands...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝W-w-w-we really should start by holding hands...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「あ、その前にもっともっとお話を…いえ、いきなりだっていいのですがっ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝Ah, we should talk more before that... no, it's sudden but...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝Ah, we should talk more before that... no, it's sudden but...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「こんなことは大変予想外で、びっくりなのです…っ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝This is so unexpected, I'm surprised...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝This is so unexpected, I'm surprised...❞

MESSAGE.JP: わふわふと首を振るクド…。
MESSAGE.EN: She was frantically shaking her head, going wafu wafu...
MESSAGE.Translation: She was frantically shaking her head, going wafu wafu...

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「クド、何を言ってるのさ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Kud, what are you saying?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Kud, what are you saying?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「西園さんのお見舞いだよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝I'm going to see Nishizono-san.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝I'm going to see Nishizono-san.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「朝、誘ってくれたじゃない」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝You asked me to in the morning, didn't you?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝You asked me to in the morning, didn't you?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「はい…？　そんなこと、私言いましたか？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝What...? I said that?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝What...? I said that?❞

MESSAGE.JP: クドが首を傾げる。
MESSAGE.EN: She cocked her head to the side.
MESSAGE.Translation: She cocked her head to the side.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「クド、冗談だよね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Kud, you are kidding, right?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Kud, you are kidding, right?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「はあ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝Well...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝Well...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「約束しましたか…？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝Are you sure we made such a promise...?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝Are you sure we made such a promise...?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「そうだよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Yes.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Yes.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「ええと…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝Well...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝Well...❞

MESSAGE.JP: クドは考え込んだ。
MESSAGE.EN: She pondered.
MESSAGE.Translation: She pondered.

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「すみません、なんでしたっけ？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝I'm sorry, I just don't remember.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝I'm sorry, I just don't remember.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「ねえ、ふざけるのはやめようよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Hey, stop joking around.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Hey, stop joking around.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「西園さんが休みだから、放課後お見舞いに来てって言ったのはクドの方だよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝You told me to come on a get-well visit for Nishizono-san because she's got a cold.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝You told me to come on a get-well visit for Nishizono-san because she's got a cold.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「西園…さん…ですか…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝Nishizono-... san...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝Nishizono-... san...❞

MESSAGE.JP: しばらくの沈黙が流れる。
MESSAGE.EN: For the next few seconds there was only silence.
MESSAGE.Translation: For the next few seconds there was only silence.

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「そう言われれば…今日はお休みでした…ね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝I said... she was absent today...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝I said... she was absent today...❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「あっ！」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝Ah!❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝Ah!❞

MESSAGE.JP: ふたたび、ぽん、と手を叩く。
MESSAGE.EN: She clapped hands once.
MESSAGE.Translation: She clapped hands once.

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「そうでした、そうでした。す、すみませんっ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝I did, I did. I, I'm sorry.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝I did, I did. I, I'm sorry.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「なんかぼんやりしていたみたいです、私…どうしちゃったんでしょうか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝Looks like I was spacing out... What ever is wrong with me?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝Looks like I was spacing out... What ever is wrong with me?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「では、行きましょうか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝Now then, let's go.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝Now then, let's go.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「うん」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Sure.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Sure.❞

MESSAGE.JP: くすぶる不安を消すことのできないまま、僕たちは女子寮に向かった。
MESSAGE.EN: Still unable to erase my smoldering worries, I made my way to the girls' dorm with her.
MESSAGE.Translation: Still unable to erase my smoldering worries, I made my way to the girls' dorm with her.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「いくら能美さんが一緒だと言っても、パジャマ姿の女性の部屋に入るのは失礼だと思いませんか？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Even though you're with Noumi-san, don't you think it's impolite to come by a girl's room when she's in her pajamas?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Even though you're with Noumi-san, don't you think it's impolite to come by a girl's room when she's in her pajamas?❞

MESSAGE.JP: 僕らは外で話すことになった。
MESSAGE.EN: We decided to talk outside.
MESSAGE.Translation: We decided to talk outside.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「…なんで制服？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝...Why are you in your uniform?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝...Why are you in your uniform?❞

MESSAGE.JP: 部屋から出てきた西園さんは、わざわざ制服を着ている。
MESSAGE.EN: I didn't think that she had needed to bother changing into that.
MESSAGE.Translation: I didn't think that she had needed to bother changing into that.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「学生としての身だしなみです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝A necessary formality for a student.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝A necessary formality for a student.❞

MESSAGE.JP: そういうものなんだ。
MESSAGE.EN: Was that the way it was?
MESSAGE.Translation: Was that the way it was?

MESSAGE.JP: ちなみに。
MESSAGE.EN: By the way.
MESSAGE.Translation: By the way.

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「きゅ、急に腹痛が大激痛で痛いのです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝I, I suddenly stomachache got a severe painful pain.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝I, I suddenly stomachache got a severe painful pain.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「部屋で休んでいればきっと大丈夫なので、おふたりで行ってきてください」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝I guess I will get better if I take a rest in the room. So, you two go on without me.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝I guess I will get better if I take a rest in the room. So, you two go on without me.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「いたいいたい」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝It hurts, it hurts.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝It hurts, it hurts.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `クド@「いたくてもーどーにかなってしまいそうですー」
MESSAGE.EN: `Kud@❝So painful I may go crazy.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Kud@❝So painful I may go crazy.❞

MESSAGE.JP: クドはむちゃくちゃ棒読みのまま、西園さんと入れ替わりに部屋の中に入っていってしまった。
MESSAGE.EN: Leaving me with that transparent lie, Kud had ducked into the room right as Nishizono-san emerged from it.
MESSAGE.Translation: Leaving me with that transparent lie, Kud had ducked into the room right as Nishizono-san emerged from it.

MESSAGE.JP: その日、授業が始まる時間になっても、西園さんは教室に姿を見せなかった。
MESSAGE.EN: On the following day, Nishizono-san did not show up in the classroom even by the beginning of the first class.
MESSAGE.Translation: On the following day, Nishizono-san did not show up in the classroom even by the beginning of the first class.

MESSAGE.JP: どうしたんだろう。
MESSAGE.EN: What happened to her?
MESSAGE.Translation: What happened to her?

MESSAGE.JP: 昨日の別れ際、少し辛そうだったから、風邪でもひいたのかも知れない。
MESSAGE.EN: Had she really caught a cold, given how she had seemed to be feeling out of sorts when we had parted yesterday?
MESSAGE.Translation: Had she really caught a cold, given how she had seemed to be feeling out of sorts when we had parted yesterday?

MESSAGE.JP: でも、誰も…その不在に触れることがない。
MESSAGE.EN: Still... no one else seemed to pay the slightest mind to her absence.
MESSAGE.Translation: Still... no one else seemed to pay the slightest mind to her absence.

MESSAGE.JP: 放課後、お見舞いに行ってみよう。
MESSAGE.EN: I made up my mind to visit her after school.
MESSAGE.Translation: I made up my mind to visit her after school.

MESSAGE.JP: 例えば真人や葉留佳さんが一日休んだとしたら、きっとみんなが口を揃えて、『今日は静かだ』『いや、天変地異の前触れだ』と言うことだろうけど。
MESSAGE.EN: If Masato or Haruka-san took a day off of school, most people in the class would be all ❛It's so peaceful today❜ or ❛No, it must be an omen of some kind of catastrophe.❜
MESSAGE.Translation: If Masato or Haruka-san took a day off of school, most people in the class would be all ❛It's so peaceful today❜ or ❛No, it must be an omen of some kind of catastrophe.❜

MESSAGE.JP: でも、おとなしい西園さんが休んだところで、クラスの騒々しさに変化はもたらされない。
MESSAGE.EN: But there was no change in the usual chatter when the ever-quiet Nishizono-san was missing.
MESSAGE.Translation: But there was no change in the usual chatter when the ever-quiet Nishizono-san was missing.

MESSAGE.JP: 何も変わらないはずだった。
MESSAGE.EN: There was supposed to be no change.
MESSAGE.Translation: There was supposed to be no change.

MESSAGE.JP: だけど。
MESSAGE.EN: However.
MESSAGE.Translation: However.

MESSAGE.JP: 僕の心はふたつの意味でざわめく。
MESSAGE.EN: There were two feelings stirring uneasily in my chest.
MESSAGE.Translation: There were two feelings stirring uneasily in my chest.

MESSAGE.JP: ひとつは、こうして認めることはなにか恥ずかしいことだけれど。
MESSAGE.EN: It was somewhat embarrassing to admit it, but...
MESSAGE.Translation: It was somewhat embarrassing to admit it, but...

MESSAGE.JP: 西園さんの姿が見えないことを、僕がとても寂しいと思っていることだ。
MESSAGE.EN: One was a loneliness stemming from her not being here.
MESSAGE.Translation: One was a loneliness stemming from her not being here.

MESSAGE.JP: 授業中、ちらちらと廊下側の空席に目がいってしまう。
MESSAGE.EN: I could not resist the urge to peek at her empty desk during class.
MESSAGE.Translation: I could not resist the urge to peek at her empty desk during class.

MESSAGE.JP: いつもはある小さな後ろ姿がないことを知っているはずなのに、それでも僕は目を向ける。
MESSAGE.EN: Despite the fact that nobody was sitting there, my eyes still kept straying to the desk.
MESSAGE.Translation: Despite the fact that nobody was sitting there, my eyes still kept straying to the desk.

MESSAGE.JP: どうしてだろう。
MESSAGE.EN: Why?
MESSAGE.Translation: Why?

MESSAGE.JP: その答えを出すことを、僕はためらう。
MESSAGE.EN: I hesitated to put the answer into words.
MESSAGE.Translation: I hesitated to put the answer into words.

MESSAGE.JP: もうひとつは…もっと漠然とした、不安だ。
MESSAGE.EN: And the other was... a more looming disquiet.
MESSAGE.Translation: And the other was... a more looming disquiet.

MESSAGE.JP: 今日に限ったことじゃなくて、この数日、何かが違うと感じていた。
MESSAGE.EN: It wasn't just today. Something had been bugging me for the past several days.
MESSAGE.Translation: It wasn't just today. Something had been bugging me for the past several days.

MESSAGE.JP: 今まで、西園さんに関わってこなかった大半のクラスメイトたち。
MESSAGE.EN: Most of the classmates, who hadn't been involved with Nishizono-san earlier...
MESSAGE.Translation: Most of the classmates, who hadn't been involved with Nishizono-san earlier...

MESSAGE.JP: 彼らは、まるで――。
MESSAGE.EN: Now they...
MESSAGE.Translation: Now they...

MESSAGE.JP: 西園さんが本当に影であるかのように、気に止める様子がなかった。
MESSAGE.EN: They did not pay any attention to her at all, as if she had been an actual shadow.
MESSAGE.Translation: They did not pay any attention to her at all, as if she had been an actual shadow.

MESSAGE.JP: 以前からもそうだった、と言われると少し違う。
MESSAGE.EN: Some might say it had always been like that, but I didn't think that was right.
MESSAGE.Translation: Some might say it had always been like that, but I didn't think that was right.

MESSAGE.JP: 確かに、西園さんに友人は少ない。
MESSAGE.EN: Admittedly, she did not have a lot of friends.
MESSAGE.Translation: Admittedly, she did not have a lot of friends.

MESSAGE.JP: 休み時間にもひとりで本を読んでいることが殆どだった。
MESSAGE.EN: She usually read books alone even during recess.
MESSAGE.Translation: She usually read books alone even during recess.

MESSAGE.JP: そして。
MESSAGE.EN: In addition to that.
MESSAGE.Translation: In addition to that.

MESSAGE.JP: 常に日傘を持っている西園さんは、変わり者だった。
MESSAGE.EN: She was considered something of a weirdo due to the fact that she carried her parasol anywhere and anytime.
MESSAGE.Translation: She was considered something of a weirdo due to the fact that she carried her parasol anywhere and anytime.

MESSAGE.JP: 変わっている、だから興味を引いた。
MESSAGE.EN: But that sort of strangeness was why I had taken an interest in her.
MESSAGE.Translation: But that sort of strangeness was why I had taken an interest in her.

MESSAGE.JP: 良い悪いは別にして、西園さんは一目置かれていたのだ。
MESSAGE.EN: No matter whether it was in a good or bad way, most of the class thought of her as peculiar.
MESSAGE.Translation: No matter whether it was in a good or bad way, most of the class thought of her as peculiar.

MESSAGE.JP: その雰囲気が、少し違っているように思えた。
MESSAGE.EN: However, that common awareness among them appeared to be a little bit different from usual now.
MESSAGE.Translation: However, that common awareness among them appeared to be a little bit different from usual now.

MESSAGE.JP: 今日、西園さんは休んでいる。
MESSAGE.EN: Today she was not in the classroom.
MESSAGE.Translation: Today she was not in the classroom.

MESSAGE.JP: そのことを気に止めている生徒は誰もいない。
MESSAGE.EN: The whole class, except Kud and a few others, was not the least concerned with it.
MESSAGE.Translation: The whole class, except Kud and a few others, was not the least concerned with it.

MESSAGE.JP: みな、いつも通りに騒がしい日常に興じている。
MESSAGE.EN: Everyone was just going about their day as normal.
MESSAGE.Translation: Everyone was just going about their day as normal.

MESSAGE.JP: 今日の不在さえも、気づいていないんじゃないかと思うくらいに。
MESSAGE.EN: Too busy to even realize that they were lacking a certain classmate.
MESSAGE.Translation: Too busy to even realize that they were lacking a certain classmate.

MESSAGE.JP: その『不在』がきっかけに、何かが動き出すんじゃないだろうか。
MESSAGE.EN: That ❛lack❜ could be a trigger that would give rise to something.
MESSAGE.Translation: That ❛lack❜ could be a trigger that would give rise to something.

MESSAGE.JP: そんな漠然とした不安が、僕には付きまとう。
MESSAGE.EN: I couldn't rid myself of this uneasy feeling.
MESSAGE.Translation: I couldn't rid myself of this uneasy feeling.

MESSAGE.JP: 僕らは、他のクラスメイトが知らない西園さんの一面を知っている。
MESSAGE.EN: We Little Busters did know aspects of her which the other people did not.
MESSAGE.Translation: We Little Busters did know aspects of her which the other people did not.

MESSAGE.JP: リトルバスターズで見せてくれた顔を、知っている。
MESSAGE.EN: We had seen the faces she only had showed to us.
MESSAGE.Translation: We had seen the faces she only had showed to us.

MESSAGE.JP: でも、本当にそうなんだろうか。
MESSAGE.EN: But was that really it?
MESSAGE.Translation: But was that really it?

MESSAGE.JP: 三時間目が終わる。
MESSAGE.EN: The third class was over.
MESSAGE.Translation: The third class was over.

MESSAGE.JP: `男子@「おはよーす」
MESSAGE.EN: `Male Student@❝Morning.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Male Student@❝Morning.❞

MESSAGE.JP: ひとりの生徒がこの時間になって教室に入ってきた。
MESSAGE.EN: At that very moment, a student entered the classroom.
MESSAGE.Translation: At that very moment, a student entered the classroom.

MESSAGE.JP: 遅刻の常連だ。
MESSAGE.EN: He usually came in late.
MESSAGE.Translation: He usually came in late.

MESSAGE.JP: 寝坊などではなく、午前中はどこかで遊んでいるとの話だ。
MESSAGE.EN: I heard it was because he used to loiter away the mornings somewhere.
MESSAGE.Translation: I heard it was because he used to loiter away the mornings somewhere.

MESSAGE.JP: 挨拶に続けて彼は、こう言った。
MESSAGE.EN: After the greeting, he went on.
MESSAGE.Translation: After the greeting, he went on.

MESSAGE.JP: `男子@「やっぱ、西園いねえんだな」
MESSAGE.EN: `Male Student@❝So Nishizono really isn't here.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Male Student@❝So Nishizono really isn't here.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 周りの生徒は『ああ、そういえば休みだね』くらいの反応だったけど。
MESSAGE.EN: His remark about Nishizono's absence stood in such stark contrast to the indifference of the rest of the class...
MESSAGE.Translation: His remark about Nishizono's absence stood in such stark contrast to the indifference of the rest of the class...

MESSAGE.JP: その言葉を聞いた僕はいても立ってもいられなかった。
MESSAGE.EN: ...that it prompted me to ask.
MESSAGE.Translation: ...that it prompted me to ask.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「西園さんがどうかしたの？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝What about her?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝What about her?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `男子@「いや、さっき西園を見たから」
MESSAGE.EN: `Male Student@❝Well, I just saw her a moment back.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Male Student@❝Well, I just saw her a moment back.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `男子@「すげえ珍しいこともあるもんだって思っただけさ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Male Student@❝And I just thought that was pretty unusual.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Male Student@❝And I just thought that was pretty unusual.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「外で？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝You saw her outside?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝You saw her outside?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `男子@「ああ。あいつがサボりなんて、ありえねえだろ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Male Student@❝Yeah. Hard to believe she would cut class, huh?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Male Student@❝Yeah. Hard to believe she would cut class, huh?❞

MESSAGE.JP: それから、さも面白そうに笑う。
MESSAGE.EN: He then laughed as though he found it hilarious.
MESSAGE.Translation: He then laughed as though he found it hilarious.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「それは間違いなく西園さんだったの？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Are you certain it was her?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Are you certain it was her?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `男子@「…いや、そう言われると自信はねえけどよ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Male Student@❝I can't be entirely sure.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Male Student@❝I can't be entirely sure.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `男子@「そもそも、あいつってどんな顔してたっけな」
MESSAGE.EN: `Male Student@❝I didn't get a good look at her face, as a matter of fact.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Male Student@❝I didn't get a good look at her face, as a matter of fact.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `男子@「さっき見た時は確かに西園だと思ったんだけど、見間違いかも知れねえ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Male Student@❝My first impression was that it was her for sure, but I could be wrong.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Male Student@❝My first impression was that it was her for sure, but I could be wrong.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `男子@「あー、やっぱ違うわ」
MESSAGE.EN: `Male Student@❝Ahh, no, it wasn't her.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Male Student@❝Ahh, no, it wasn't her.❞

MESSAGE.JP: いきなり納得したような大きな声を出す。
MESSAGE.EN: He said louder and with conviction.
MESSAGE.Translation: He said louder and with conviction.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「どういうこと？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝How can you be sure?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝How can you be sure?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `男子@「だって、日傘をしてなかったもんな」
MESSAGE.EN: `Male Student@❝She wasn't with her parasol.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Male Student@❝She wasn't with her parasol.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `男子@「『カゲナシ』が、そんなわけねえからな」
MESSAGE.EN: `Male Student@❝❛No shadow❜ has it with her all the time, doesn't she?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Male Student@❝❛No shadow❜ has it with her all the time, doesn't she?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「そう…」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Oh...❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Oh...❞

MESSAGE.JP: …西園さんがサボりとは、考えにくい。
MESSAGE.EN: ...It was hard to imagine her cutting class in the first place.
MESSAGE.Translation: ...It was hard to imagine her cutting class in the first place.

MESSAGE.JP: きっと、風邪でもひいたんだろう。
MESSAGE.EN: She must have caught a cold or something.
MESSAGE.Translation: She must have caught a cold or something.

MESSAGE.JP: もし体調が良くなったところで、日中に街に出かけるとも思えない。
MESSAGE.EN: Even if she was feeling better, it was not likely that she'd go out to the town in broad daylight.
MESSAGE.Translation: Even if she was feeling better, it was not likely that she'd go out to the town in broad daylight.

MESSAGE.JP: 彼が言うとおり、見間違いだ、の一言で片付けるのが一番のはずなんだけど。
MESSAGE.EN: Just like he had said, it would be best to conclude that he must have been mistaken.
MESSAGE.Translation: Just like he had said, it would be best to conclude that he must have been mistaken.

MESSAGE.JP: 先ほどから感じている不安は、大きくなるばかりだ。
MESSAGE.EN: Yet the apprehension which had been haunting me was growing larger and larger.
MESSAGE.Translation: Yet the apprehension which had been haunting me was growing larger and larger.

MESSAGE.JP: 先日、僕も見た。
MESSAGE.EN: The other day.
MESSAGE.Translation: The other day.

MESSAGE.JP: 西園さんと良く似た女の子が歩いているのを。
MESSAGE.EN: I had also seen a girl that very strongly resembled Nishizono-san.
MESSAGE.Translation: I had also seen a girl that very strongly resembled Nishizono-san.

MESSAGE.JP: その子も傘を差していなかった。
MESSAGE.EN: And that girl had not had a parasol either.
MESSAGE.Translation: And that girl had not had a parasol either.

MESSAGE.JP: 僕だけじゃなく、他にも見た人がいる。
MESSAGE.EN: Now there was somebody else here who had run across that girl.
MESSAGE.Translation: Now there was somebody else here who had run across that girl.

MESSAGE.JP: 見間違い、で果たして済むんだろうか。
MESSAGE.EN: Was she really not Nishizono-san?
MESSAGE.Translation: Was she really not Nishizono-san?

MESSAGE.JP: 落ち着かないままに、一日が終わる。
MESSAGE.EN: Without me being able to dispel my uneasiness, the day's lessons drew to an end.
MESSAGE.Translation: Without me being able to dispel my uneasiness, the day's lessons drew to an end.

MESSAGE.JP: 女子寮の寮長さんに事情を話して、西園さんの部屋まで案内してもらう。
MESSAGE.EN: I explained to the dorm mother and asked her to take me to Nishizono-san's room.
MESSAGE.Translation: I explained to the dorm mother and asked her to take me to Nishizono-san's room.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「…パジャマ姿の女性の部屋に入るのは失礼だと思いませんか？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝...Don't you think it's impolite to come by a girl's room when she's in her pajamas?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝...Don't you think it's impolite to come by a girl's room when she's in her pajamas?❞

MESSAGE.JP: 僕らは外で話すことになった。
MESSAGE.EN: We decided to talk outside.
MESSAGE.Translation: We decided to talk outside.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「…なんで制服？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝...Why are you in your uniform?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝...Why are you in your uniform?❞

MESSAGE.JP: 部屋から出てきた西園さんは、わざわざ制服を着ている。
MESSAGE.EN: I didn't think that she had needed to bother changing into that.
MESSAGE.Translation: I didn't think that she had needed to bother changing into that.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「学生としての身だしなみです」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝A necessary formality for a student.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝A necessary formality for a student.❞

MESSAGE.JP: そういうものなんだ。
MESSAGE.EN: Was that the way it was?
MESSAGE.Translation: Was that the way it was?

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「もう大丈夫なの？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Are you feeling better now?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Are you feeling better now?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「はい、朝はちょっと起きれなかったのですが。心配をおかけしました」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Yes. I wasn't able to get up in the morning, but I'm okay now. Thank you for your concern.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Yes. I wasn't able to get up in the morning, but I'm okay now. Thank you for your concern.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 夕焼けの下で見る西園さんの顔は、その言葉通りに顔色もよくて、ひとまず安心する。
MESSAGE.EN: Just as she said, her complexion seemed perfectly healthy under the sunset's glow.
MESSAGE.Translation: Just as she said, her complexion seemed perfectly healthy under the sunset's glow.

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「じゃあ、明日は来られそうだね」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Then you can come to school tomorrow?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Then you can come to school tomorrow?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「多分、問題ないでしょう」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝I don't expect there will be any problems.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝I don't expect there will be any problems.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「そう、それはよかった」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Glad to hear that.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Glad to hear that.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「ねえ…ちょっと訊きたいんだけど」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Well... let me just ask you something.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Well... let me just ask you something.❞

MESSAGE.JP: 昼間のことが気にかかる。
MESSAGE.EN: I had to confirm...
MESSAGE.Translation: I had to confirm...

MESSAGE.JP: 街中で西園さんを見かけた、という目撃談のことだ。
MESSAGE.EN: ...whether or not she had actually gone into town.
MESSAGE.Translation: ...whether or not she had actually gone into town.

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「なんでしょうか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝What is it?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝What is it?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `理樹@「今日は一日、寝ていたの？」
MESSAGE.EN: `Riki@❝Have you been sleeping all day?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Riki@❝Have you been sleeping all day?❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「…どういう趣旨での発言なのか、とても気になります」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝...I'm very curious what the point of your question is.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝...I'm very curious what the point of your question is.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「わたしの寝姿を見たい、という意味なのでしょうか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝You mean you wanted to watch my sleeping figure?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝You mean you wanted to watch my sleeping figure?❞

MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝.........❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝.........❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「破廉恥です」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝That's abominable.❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝That's abominable.❞

MESSAGE.JP: `西園@「風邪で弱ってるところにつけ込もうというのでしょうか」
MESSAGE.EN: `Nishizono@❝Or do you mean you were intending to do something to me while I was weakened by a cold?❞
MESSAGE.Translation: `Nishizono@❝Or do you mean you were intending to do something to me while I was weakened by a cold?❞
